hasVariant.name: Air-Liner Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the Vittoria Air-Liner Tool online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Air-Liner Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the Vittoria Air-Liner Tool online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
If you have any kind of tubeless tires, you need this tool, even if you do not have liners. Tires that were impossible to remove from the rim will come off in a snap with these pliers. They grip the sidewalls like a steel vise and do not let go. They allow you to pull the tire and bead off the rim shoulder and into the rim bed so the tire can be removed. These literally work flawlessly where Visegrips have failed. The pliers are also helpful with installing tires since you can pinch the beads together into the rim bed while moving them toward the valve to create some slack in the beads.

The tire levers built into the ends of the handle are, by far, the best in the world. Regular plastic levers of all brands will break in half on a stubborn bead, and steel core levers will scratch and mar the finish on the side of your rims. But these levers work perfectly on even the most obstinate tire bead. The handles are much longer than a regular tire lever and provide much more leverage. Since they are connected at the hinge, they work in unison. Due to their shape and material, they will not damage your rim or cut your rim tape. They're made from a very hard and stiff plastic that does not flex or break under load.

The included plastic clips also do a great job of holding the bead on the rim while you leverage the other end of the bead. You just need to jam them between the tire and rim where the bead goes into the rim bed, perpendicular to the rim. Unlike another reviewer, I've had no problem whatsoever with the rubber grippers on the pliers coming loose.
review.name: Best tubeless tire tool ever invented

review.reviewBody:
The Essential:  If you're running air liners in road or cyclocross tires, I think this tool is required to unseat the bead if you value your hands and time.  It can cleanly unseat the bead on one side, then flip and do the other in a few minutes time.  The built in tire levers in the handle are also awesome as they give you a good base area to pry next to with another lever to unseat a tire.

The Frustrating:  The rubber protector tips on the ends that contact your tire and rim and super loose and just fall off constantly while you're repositioning the tool (or just moving it at all).  The really are needed to get enough grip on the tire to unseat a stubborn bead, so you need to just keep putting them back on.

I intend to superglue these on before the next time I need to use them, but it feels like a really poor design to have loose fitting high contact parts.

My experiences with these were using Vittoria Terreno Mix tires on Mercury M1 and American Classic TCX wheels.
review.name: Essential and Frustrating

name: Air-Liner Tool

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with these pants. I wear them for cold weather running, hiking, and snowboarding… or simply walking to the gym when it’s cold outside. They could not be more comfortable. I highly recommend.
review.name: Fit, form, and function

review.reviewBody: I was surprised how large they were.  I  ordered a large. I am 185 lbs 6’ 34 waist. Way too big. The waist pulls way up, I like the waist on my hips. I had to return .
review.name: Runs large

review.reviewBody: I own a couple pairs of Columbia fleece pants that I love but they no longer make. I was looking for a similar product when I came across these pants from Backcountry. I was really skeptical about buying their in-house name brand but took a gamble on them as they seemed like the only pants in existence that were somewhat similar to the Columbia ones I own. These pants ended up being even better than the ones I was trying to match. Super comfortable, excellent stretch, just the right thickness and warmth, and has a zipper fly. These pants are like if sweatpants and hiking pants had a baby. Exterior material is a woven soft shell material that feels nice and looks durable. There's plenty of stretch in these pants that you could use them from yoga, to rock climbing, to the gym, and possibly even to the office depending on where you work. I'm a 32 waist in most clothing so I purchased a medium. The fit is good but it's a bit looser than I prefer so if you like your pants more trim maybe size down to a small. There's plenty of stretch in the waist to allow for adjustment with the built in cord to tie them. The pants fit loose on me but not to the point I feel like they will slowly fall down when I have things in my pocket. If you want a comfortable pair of pants for cooler weather activities these are pretty great. Thank you back country! I bought 2 of the 3 colors and am really wanting to get the green color as well.
review.name: Fleece lined technical stretch pants.

name: Destination Softshell Fleece Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Honestly, I already have a three year old Blue Jacket in the black and pine green color, but bought a Prijon Beast in almost this same Glacier Blue, and just could not pass up have a matching PFD.  My old one is now dedicated to pushing rubber, where it compliments a Shredder with esteem!  I will love them both equally~
review.name: The best, in BLUE!

review.reviewBody: Comfy but secure fit, love the low profile allowing a great range of motion. Clam shell front zip pocket is quite handy for things like rescue carabiners, snacks, or a fly box. I can wear the Blue all day and forget I'm wearing it.
review.name: Comfy and secure

review.reviewBody: I have been a boater since 1996 and this is by far the best PFD I have ever had.  The clamshell pocket is ample in size and by design very easy to access.  The profile allows for unimpeded movement while delivering 16.4 pounds of floatation.  The placement of the straps allows for a fit that feels as comfortable as it secure.  I especially appreciate the design of the shoulder strap adjustments that make it easy to adjust from the lower front of the pfd rather than the awkward top of the strap standard. The build quality of this vest is industry unmatched IMHO. Thanks Astral!
review.name: At last, the perfect PFD.

review.reviewBody: I have been looking for a good versatile and comfortable PFD. I’m an Instructor and teach safety in my classes so often play the rescue victim so know how effective it is when in the water and out of your boat. I also serve as a safety boat for paddling events so have towed a number of Kayaks, Canoes and SUPs for exhausted or injured paddlers as it performs well. I enjoy sea kayaking and surfski paddling so paddle often in rough conditions and confident the Green Jacket adds additional safety. It has plenty of flotation and appreciate the extra protection it gives my rib cage. I did some open water rescue training on Lake Superior in windy conditions there was never a problem with the Green Jacket it stayed secure and in place. I recently purchased a second one as we spend the winter paddling season in Texas so want to always have one handy.
review.name: The Versatile Green Jacket is just what I needed.

review.reviewBody:
The fit is great. It’s designed so well that I barely know I have it on. The bottom part gently hugs my torso, very comfortably moving with me. Yet, the front clamshell stay’s slightly away from my body, even when its separate straps are pulled down tight, making it feel roomy and freeing. And the cut up top leaves plenty of room for every movement. It’s really a brilliant, innovative design. 

The small, side gear pockets and the large front storage pocket (with really smart and convenient sun pockets) is also definitely a huge plus!
review.name: Comfortable, Innovative, Brilliant Design

review.reviewBody: Loving the Blue jacket. Lighter than my old Green Jacket. The flip down front pocket is the main reason I bought the jacket. Plus I can slip in a tow harness if I need to be prepared for doing any light rescue work.
review.name: Another Winner

review.reviewBody: This is my second bluejacket and I love it, love the side entry, love hopping off the raft to swim in it, love the large frontal pocket for sunscreen and the small back pockets for guests trash.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody:
Perfect PFD for freestyle kajaking. Thanks to a lot of freedom of movement and wearing comfort.
I love the colour and the lightweight.
I also use it in my touring kayak.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this about a year ago specifically because I liked the fit of the green jacket but wanted the hydration bladder as well as a side entry.

Though the hydration bladder (not included) takes some practice getting the loops connected so it hangs properly, I’ve never had a problem with it “falling out” while I’m wearing it even when I’m swimming class III/IV rapids. That just sounds like user error. It does fall out once you take the jacket off though, which is annoying. I think the ability to access to water outside of my spray skirt highly overcomes that annoyance though. My only gripe is that the tube doesn’t fully secure to my shoulder strap and so I need to tuck it into my hand sleeve and tighten the sleeve down when I’m not using it. The mag clip that comes with the bladder does not fit the connections on the shoulder strap.

When the bladder is full, you have a snug fit so if you’re right on the edge of sizing, I would suggest sizing up if you plan to use the bladder.

I would also like to see newer models of the blue in the cool custom designs that they make the green in each year.

Fix the should strap attachment point for the tube, make sure the bladder doesn’t fall off when you toss it in your gear bag, include some cool designs and I will totally purchase again when mine wears out.
review.name: I love the bladder but it takes practice

review.reviewBody: Yes, I am going to be a bit harsh on this review. I would give this pfd five stars if it had an adequate a hydration option.  Regrettably it does not.  It meets all my other needs as a sea kayaker and instructor, but one. I find this to be a major failure. I have been using either the older Astral Sea Wolf or my newer Blue Jacket as my PFD of choice for the last ten years, but I have always had to jerry-rig my on water hydration system.  Astral claims the BlueJacket is compatible with the Camelbak Crux 1.5 L H2O bladder, but I have yet to find a kayaker that uses the Crux with the BlueJacket.  I just purchased said bladder to give it a try.  It really does not work. Didn't anyone test this out? You might be able to mount the Crux inside the BlueJacket, but you will not want to wear it for any length of time. It's difficult at best to hang the Crux off of the two recessed web straps in the BlueJacket. They are located way-up and behind the pfd‚Äôs mesh back panel, but it is possible with patience and dexterity. What I cannot tolerate is the large hard plastic of lid of the Crux jammed against my spinal column. This set-up is not tolerable just walking around the house.  I cannot image trying to paddle while wearing it. It‚Äôs back to a jerry-rig.
review.name: Hydration option for the BlueJacket it a failure

name: BlueJacket Personal Flotation Device

description: Buy the Gregory Arrio 24L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Arrio 24L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Arrio 24L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Believe it or not, it's not easy finding a quality backpack that can strap to your airline luggage.
I have traveled with my Gregory for years and it has never let me down. This pack is for my wife and she loves it!
One pack, several ways to use it.
review.name: Just the pack we needed.

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack for daytrips in the Scottish Highlands and it has never disappointed me now that I am back on campus. It has roomy well-placed pockets, plenty of strength and frame support and the ventilated back keeps you you cool. If a day pack is what you're looking for, this pack js an awesome choice.
review.name: Outstanding pack

review.reviewBody: Fantastic backpack for light day hikes. I've used it on 10 ish mile hikes and been really happy as its light and has good airflow. If oyu need a serious backpack this isnt the one as its not very big and the waist straps are useless. But for a simple day hike its perfect.

This is a great little daypack.  I love how Gregory included the features of a big backpack in a smaller package.  The mesh keeps your back cool and the draw cord closure quick and convenient.  My only issue is that a nalgene tends to fall out of the water bottle pocket if you bend down.
review.name: Nice little daypack

review.reviewBody: Amazing day pack. Super light weight, multiple different pockets on the front and the inside. The trampoline backing system is amazing for airflow and a really sleek nice looking design. Love this bag !
I am very happy with this bag. The backpanel is breathable, it holds enough for a good day hike
review.name: Great single day hiking pack

review.reviewBody: It's a good quality backpack that I can use for all season day hikes; plenty of space to carry enough water, clothes, as well as food for a day.
review.name: Nice day hike backpack

review.reviewBody: This pack is so lightweight and comfortable. It has all of the pockets and features I need with out all the extra zippers and stuff that get in the way. The suspension system carries weight well and is super breathable. This will be the pack I use all summer long!!
review.name: The best day pack!

name: Arrio 24L Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is without a doubt the most comfortable pack that I've used! I chose this pack because it's light, has enough space for all the gear to do multi-day backcountry climbing, and is women specific, and it did not disappoint. Went on a 4 day climbing trip and experienced no discomfort when wearing the pack (my load probably weighed 40ish pounds). I'm excited to test it out with even more weight in the future. The material seems really durable and I was impressed at how much stuff I could fit in the convenient hip pockets. It was great to have snacks and a light jacket at the ready! The only features I really would love to have added are a bottle pocket and front stash pocket. I did end up adding a bottle holder to the shoulder strap which was really nice as I'm not really into bladders. Also, as a side note, I used this pack for cragging and it does take a little extra effort to get the rope bag in there because it's a little narrow, but not a big deal. I'm really happy with this pack and cannot recommend it enough!
review.name: This is without a doubt

name: Ariel Pro 75L Backpack - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’m not sure who they make these jackets for. I’m 5’8” with a n athletic build. The medium is too tight and short. The large is too baggy and puffy.
review.name: Very odd sizing

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great warmth and weatherproofing in a lightweight form. 8+ years wearing this.
review.name: Great midlayer and everyday jacket.

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is one of my favorite jackets.  Very warm for it's weight.   I can see why this jacket is so popular.   Can be worn in the backcountry or in town.
review.name: Great jacket

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Pretty sure the jacket had been worn prior to receiving it. Weird perfume smell took 3 washes to get rid of. Coat has been good, after the smell dissipated.
review.name: Nano puff

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've had this jacket for nearly 3 years now but it's a staple for my wardrobe.  I can wear it comfortable in temperatures from mid 20s-mid 50s and not get too hot or too cold.  I've used it as a mid-layer while skiing in single digit temperatures and it works great!  I can't recommend this jacket enough!
review.name: Best Jacket Ever

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: After ordering three other jackets form competitors the Patagaonia clearly fit the best. Had the most room in the armpit which allows for my arms to articulate. Fits great in back pack.
review.name: Patagonia Nano Puff.

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Was looking for a super light jacket for hikes since I tend to get warm at any altitude and this jacket is perfect for it! Can tuck it away in my pack without taking up too much room, and keeps me warm when the wind starts picking up.
review.name: Super light great fit
comment:
What size did you buy?
Looking for something tall and slim and not short in the arms

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I am an alpine photographer in Colorado and backcountry skier. 

This is an Excellent thermal layer and stuffs easily. 

6? 180 lbs with fairly wide shoulders and range of motion is good with large size.
review.name: Excellent backcountry alpine layer

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wore this today in moderately cold weather over a down vest and fleece base layer.  The jacket looked and felt great, aided by the vest and base layer.  Perfectly fitted hood is snug around your face, with or without a hat.  The neck zips up high and forms a nice seal around your neck.  The side pockets are deep and placed right for easy stowage or hand warming.  Patagonia makes excellent down coats, generally.  The nano puff is no exception.
review.name: Great ultralight puffy

review.itemreviewed: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: It?s a running joke that I never leave home without it. I bring this jacket everywhere and am on my 2nd one. First one was stolen after some aggressive oyster eating in Northern California. Someone is enjoying my lovely jacket. But I replaced it with the exact same one. That?s love. I use this jacket in the backcountry as a mid layer. I run hot so I don?t really need another mid layer jacket. This thickness keeps me warm even on really cold days skiing.
review.name: My favorite nano puffy for all things

name: Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
Nano Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the MSR Reactor 2.5L Stove System online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Reactor 2.5L Stove System
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Reactor 2.5L Stove System online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: On a recent trip my MSR Reactor stove shut down; completely stopped working. When you are on an extended trip this is a big deal. I was frustrated, mad and disappointed in MSR. But in a world of sophisticated high-performance outdoor equipment things happen. Such incidents are unfortunate and leaves user no choice but to find a work-around when they do happen. Afterwards, with an expensive piece of unusable equipment in hand, the question becomes, will the company who sold me this product stand behind it? I buy MSR products because they have a reputation for doing just that. In this case MSR replaced not only the stove but, because the unit was out of stock, they went the extra step of replacing the entire system. In my experience paying a bit more for quality is never a mistake
review.name: Stands behind their product

review.reviewBody: I purchased this product in Korea and am extremely satisfied with its performance. It's incredibly lightweight, durable, and boils water rapidly. During my hiking trips in Korea, all of my cousins were impressed by its capabilities. This product is like magic, enabling me to prepare kimchi stew or budae stew within 5 minutes, even in the cold mountains. Korean culture includes enjoying grilled bbq even in remote locations, so in my opinion having a lightweight and portable grill that complements the reactor would be fantastic. Thank you for consistently producing outstanding products.
review.name: Great for backpacking

review.reviewBody: I love this cooking system. However, on a 10 day sea kayaking trip in SE Alaska my Reactor failed without explanation. It simply wouldn't pass fuel through. No field repair was possible. When I called MSR I was told "this happens sometimes" and was reminded that I could always soak my food and eat it cold. I had to purchase a new cooking unit. I continue to use the system because it works so well but will never again take it on an extended trip without a backup system.
review.name: Can't be repaired

review.reviewBody: We use these on all of our group backpacking trips for boiling water for our boil in the bag meals. Efficient and fast! We usually carry two for a group of 10-12, but could definitely manage with one.
review.name: Group backpacking.

review.reviewBody: Whoever said "a watched pot never boils" didn't have a Reactor. One of my most satisfying purchases ever.
review.name: Hot water on demand

review.reviewBody: Still the Gold Standard for speed to melt snow and bring it to a boil, even @ high altitude and using the least fuel. It can be outside the tent in windy conditions at low temps with no additional windscreen and still deliver performance that beats all other competitors. I have used a Reactor stove since they first came out and now I have a Tote bin full of other brand stoves aaccumulated over 30 years that go unused
review.name: Still the best in my opinion

review.reviewBody: I really like the Reactor system. Super fast and efficient. The 1.7L nests nicely with the Deep Dish bowl. This is great when melting snow because you can put the canister in water and keep the fuel from freezing. The 1.0L needs a similar (smaller) nesting bowl! I would love it if MSR made a Deep Dish cup/bowl that nested on the bottom in the same way as the 1.7L does. Please, MSR, if you’re listening, make a Deep Dish cup/bowl for the 1.0L Reactor!
review.name: 1.0L version needs a nesting bowl

review.reviewBody: I have owned the Reactor since 2010 and used it as a 2-person stove to hiked the PCT, Arizona trail, trips to Alaska in all types of weather conditions and never a problem, heats so fast you cannot turn your back and found 8 oz fuel can do 5 days hot meals breakfast and dinner for two. I still own the original MSR...just can't part with its many decades of adventure memories. Will be rowing from Seattle to Alaska in May 2022 with our Reactor!
review.name: Bomb Proof

review.reviewBody: I have used this stove for multiple paddle camping trips, hiking, car camping, and even just an outing to the local parks. It's reliable, efficient, gas saving, and burns water fast in any situation I have faced so far. The speed it boils water is unparalleled. I'm buying a delux stove for other cooking purposes.
review.name: amazing stove

review.reviewBody: I have had this Reactor since 2015, love it! Sadly the burner is now slow/dont work and it is not possible to buy a new one without buying a whole set.
review.name: Burner stop working, pot is fine

name: Reactor 2.5L Stove System

review.itemreviewed: Utilitas Hiking Zip Off Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality trousers and value for money . Very comfortable to wear. Would buy more and recommend.
review.name: Great trousers!

review.itemreviewed: Utilitas Hiking Zip Off Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: The pants are durable and the zippers function and stow well. However these pants run large, I am a 29" waist and usually always TTS Medium in any brand, however with these I use up the entire belt and could still do with more fabric to further tighten them. Because of this they look baggy as well. I would size down if you are right on the edge of a size difference.
review.name: Run large

review.itemreviewed: Utilitas Hiking Zip Off Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Who would have thought that zip-off pants could look so cute? I once would never be caught in zip-off pants, but I have to say I am obsessed with these. I wore them for 8 days straight while backpacking the Wonderland Trail around Mt. Rainier and they were perfect.  So nice to be able to easily switch between shorts and pants during a long trip! The zips on the ankles also make it so easy to take one and off over your hiking shoes! Fit was great, maybe a little loose for my usual size but I didn't mind the extra room.
review.name: honestly the BEST hiking pants

review.itemreviewed: Utilitas Hiking Zip Off Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight, easy zipper, looking great. I'm a girl with feminine hips so I had to upsize two sizes. 
Long Version fits me better (1,78 m).

Three points of criticism:
- Beige Version isn't squat-proof
- I'm missing a smartphone-pocket on the leg, the ones on the hips aren't ideal for a bulky phone 
- The Belt isn't going around the trousers, it's attached to the sides. 
So if you need to tight it up, it creates creases on the front.

Haven't tested it in the wild yet but looking forward to it.
review.name: Nice trousers with little points of criticism

review.itemreviewed: Utilitas Hiking Zip Off Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Always use when hiking when raining can hold all my things
review.name: Great use

review.itemreviewed: Utilitas Hiking Zip Off Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Water and wind repellent, perfect 2-in-1 pant for whatever weather nature wants to throw at you. I’m 5’1, 120lbs and the medium was the good slightly baggy fit that I wanted with extra thigh leg room, without being too long length-wise. 10/10 would recommend!
review.name: Perfect for rainy days

review.itemreviewed: Utilitas Hiking Zip Off Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these for Patagonia - I was looking for lightweight water resistant comfortable trousers with which I could wear  thermal leggings. I haven’t not yet had the opportunity to try them effectively for their intended purpose (I am only going away in a couple of weeks), but they have meet all expectations so far and look great.
review.name: A great but for me

review.itemreviewed: Utilitas Hiking Zip Off Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Perfect for hiking and biking in different weather conditions. Light, comfortable. Good stretch material. All in one. This what I want.
review.name: Perfect trousers for hiking and biking.

review.itemreviewed: Utilitas Hiking Zip Off Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit great and versatile with zip-off legs! Like the integrated belt and pockets, too.
review.name: Awesome hiking pants

review.itemreviewed: Utilitas Hiking Zip Off Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I spent over a month researching various brands of hiking pants. I
landed on the black pair of these and I’m not sure what would make a better convertible pant. The fit is literally perfect, fits at the small part of waist, plenty of leg room, light and airy for rigorous hikes, and no bulky pockets that I would not use anyway. This is the one pair of pants I bring backpacking, and they fit great over a base layer for windy/colder evenings. I truly hope Adidas keeps making these, and in other colors!
review.name: These are the best.

name: Utilitas Hiking Zip Off Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Overall, the Gregory Jade is a durable pack. But, after hiking the 350-mile Pinhoti Trail, I'm going to look for a lighter pack. A couple of days before I left, the grap strap broke and I had to take it to a shoe repair shop to get it sewn back on. Then, while I was on trail, the chest strap broke off of the sliding ridge and I had to use paracord to tie it to the shoulder strap. And, even after 4 weeks of hiking, my back and shoulders were sore from the 25-ish pound pack weight. It could also benefit from larger hip belt pockets and a much larger back pocket.
review.name: Needs work
comment: Thanks for leaving your review.  Please contact our customer service team so we can help with some of the issues you reported.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have had the same pack for over 20 years, so when I slipped this new beaut on I felt a bit like cheating, but those feelings quickly went away. It’s super comfortable (fits my body well), I liked the layout and it was a perfect size for a one-night adventure (I got the 53). The second time I used it I lent it to a friend with a different body type and she loved it as well. Another great pack from Gregory!
review.name: Love this pack!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am very happy with this pack. I love that it zips around so that I don't have to remove everything from my the bag to get the stuff on the bottom. I also really like the bottom zipper as an extra compartment. In my old bag, I had to dangle everything on the outside off of carabiners, so this is nice. It is also very comfortable to wear and adjusts easily. All in all, this is an awesome backpack!
review.name: Great pack!

review.reviewBody: I bought this backpack at the end of my hiking season but it's so great. It took me a while to choose the size but the website gave me all the proper information to make the decision and the backpacks fits perfectly now! I am super happy with it.
review.name: Great Backpack!

review.reviewBody: Great physical design, and great usability in all sizes. Love the new orange and Gregory's exploration of color. I've had 28L and this is a good size upgrade for people who need to pack more for anything from a 1-day backpacking trip, general travel, or car camping. Took it across a lake to canoe camp and the rain cover helped keep things dry. It's a great product for just about anyone who needs a backpack of this size.
review.name: Jade always wins.

name: Jade 53L Backpack - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Kelty Wireless 4 Tent: 4-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
It was good until it wasn't. Used less than 4 times and the support ridge pole which is essential to keep the rain fly up snapped in half. I understand that poles break, but the design of this requires lots of pressure that causes the aluminum pole to bend over time, eventually leading it to break. Instructions even note to "watch your eyes" when installing the pole due to the high tension. I assume the replacement pole will eventually break as well. 

If you are using this to camp in your backyard this might be an okay option.
review.name: Avoid - Better Options - Poor Design

name: Wireless 4 Tent: 4-Person 3-Season

review.itemreviewed: FR-C MTB Bib Short Liner + Pockets - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I’ve been putting miles in on this liner for probably 6 months now. I wear these under my baggies and have had absolutely zero complaints. From quick after work rides to all day excursions, these are the liners I’m consistently reaching for. 

Here’s what I love about them:
1. Pockets - three pockets in the small of your back to hold phone, wallet, keys. No need for a pack. 
2. Chamois - I’ve yet to meet anyone (and most of us Gearheads have ridden in Giordana’s shorts) who don’t like the Cirro S chamois. Just padded enough but not bulky, antimicrobial, and BREATHABLE.
3. Materials - great 4 way stretch, less compressive than their road FR-C line, and stays in place. Straps are super comfy, and the laser-cut, hemless bottom cuffs are not noticeable. No silicone leg grippers, but I’ve had no issues with the legs bunching or slipping up even on my scrawny chicken legs. 

Fit: I’m 6’2”, 145 lbs, built like Gumby, and I wear a medium. Giordana, even though they’re an authentic Italian brand, fit more true to size than similar options from Santini and Castelli, for example. I bounce between medium and large for those brands, but between small and medium for Giordana, Pearl Izumi, etc. They are not that compressive (which I like for mtb), and the studio images for these are a tad misleading in that they’re not quite as sheer of a material as you may think. I’ll even consider riding gravel/road in these if I haven’t done my laundry like a responsible adult. 

Care: official recommendation for Giordana shorts is to cold wash right after a ride and hang dry. No need for chamois cream. These things hold up.
review.name: One Liner To Rule Them All

name: FR-C MTB Bib Short Liner + Pockets - Men's

review.reviewBody: Really like these shorts. They’re very comfortable and the fabric is soft and lightweight. The downside is that they do stretch out a lot. I probably could have sized down to the 4, which seemed too tight at first. I’m 5’2” and 120lbs. So far have used them for casual wear and walks around the neighborhood.

review.reviewBody: These shorts are great and very comfortable. I ordered both my usual size (10) and a size up based on reviews of other pants from this brand. I'm very glad I sized up! There is no way the 10 would have fit comfortably, while the 12 feels great. The stretch makes them easy to move in. And I appreciate the longer inseam, which feels flattering while preventing the dreaded thigh chafe of shorter shorts.
review.name: Glad I sized up

review.reviewBody: Really nice length, good flexibility, decent sized pockets, and the material is surprisingly soft. So far I've used them hiking and at work. I'm not sure I'd climb in them, I used them once for rappelling and they showed every bit of sweat. So I mostly use them for casual wear and they are great for that.

comment: Hello Amy, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our JOAN NOW™ Women's Chelsea Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: These are cute boots, but I would not recommend them for a lot of walking. I wore them walking around Chicago this past weekend and my feet were ACHING after a few hours. I’ll have to put some inserts in them if I decide to ever wear them beyond a couple hours. Also, get your regular size. I normally wear a 7 and sized up to a 7.5, and I really could’ve stuck with the 7.
review.name: Cute, but not for walking.
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.reviewBody: These have a much rounder toe than expected and are unbelievably narrow and tight over the top of the foot. I wish they hadn’t been final sale. My feet go numb wearing them.
review.name: Narrow and too tight on top of foot
comment: Hello Annie, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our JOAN NOW™ Women's Chelsea Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.name: Best looking boots!!

review.reviewBody: These are the Chelseas I’ve been looking for! Best fitting, easy in, looks great. True to size. So awesome. Glad I found these for fall and winter.
review.name: Great fit. Comfortable.

review.reviewBody: The greatest boot ever!  So comfortable and cute that I bought another color!
review.name: LOVE

review.reviewBody: I have wide feet with tall bridge so have hard time buying cute shoes. These are tight and hard to put on at first for me but after a while of a little suffering the shoe conforms to my foot. This is the third pair of sorry boots I bought. I don’t really like the company but I have very limited options for quality boots that actually fit my feet. :(
review.name: Good for wide feed/ leather conforms

review.reviewBody:
I’ve worn and loved Sorel boots for years. 
This is the first time I have regrets. 
Bought the Chelsea in black at a famous retailer for NYC life
I’ve almost tripped forward walking down the subway stairs twice as the back heel has clips designed into it and it catches the edge stair railing. Frightening! 
I am now afraid to wear them. Such a waste. If you look closely at the back heel you will understand. Not designed for going down steps unfortunately
review.name: Beware of back heel clips
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.reviewBody:
these are so fun and I love them!  they are an updated style from my ABSOLUTE favorite shoe (Joan of Arctic Chelsea Wedge Bootie).  I chose this color for the fun eye pop that makes the style stand out.  I love the heel - comfortable and stable. The soles are thick enough to keep you warm and tread is helpful in the wintery terrain so you maintain traction. I did size down from my wedge but I could have gone with the 1/2 size bigger if I needed to. I can sometimes vary between sizes anyway. I needed to wear longer socks to break in the cuff at the top of the ankle- I would expect this though - it is an easy work around.   
I think I will purchase these in a black and I will not need to own any other casual shoe!
review.name: Must have for the stylish foot!

hasVariant.name: Accent Convertible 17L Laptop Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Accent Convertible 17L Laptop Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very pleased that I bought this computer bag. Thule exceeds expectations again!
review.name: Excellent Product

review.reviewBody: J’ai acheté pour mon fils un sac qui fait aussi un sac à dos et je lui si donné pour Noël et il était très satisfait de ce cadeau. Merci.
review.name: Très bon achat

review.reviewBody:
The Thule accent convertible backpack is great for travel. It's functional, relatively compact but still with enough room for what I need it for. I just used it for travel for the first time to carry my laptop, cables, travel documents, and glasses. I really really like that it doubles in function, since I also used it as a conventional laptop briefcase for a work meeting in the same trip (so I don't have to carry more bags than the necessary). The number of pockets is just about right for carrying all essentials. I would highly recommend it.

I only found a couple minor details that I wish were different (none of these deter from the value of the product, although a change in the zippers would be really nice). 1) I would really like it more if the zippers were designed to be lockable (with loops), 2) The backpack connectors are made of a plastic that looks like it could easily break. Time will tell. 3) The backpack sits a little bit high, perhaps a little more room to adjust the straps would be useful.
review.name: Very functional

review.reviewBody: Thule alway is my favorite products (like roof rack and camping gears, and backpack...) because of the design and high quality in itself. Keep up the good work, don't cut corners to compete with others. Thank you for providing the quality that we can put the trust on. we will continue support your products. have a pleasant day.
review.name: Awsome Product

review.reviewBody: High-quality urban case/backpack. My best recommendations.
review.name: High quality product

review.reviewBody: I have the same backpack in previous version. The quality of this new version is inferior. There are no compartments inside. The biggest problem to me is the side bottle holder is all mesh material. I put my thermo bottle there. Mesh can be easily damaged with holes over time. The previous version solved this problem by using the same nylon material as the backpack at the bottom of the bottle holder, and mesh material on top to give the flexibility. Very disappointed and decided to return.
review.name: Quality not as good as previous version

review.reviewBody: Great, has a lap top pocket that’s removable, but no additional dividers inside which was a bummer but that’s alright
review.name: Great pack

review.reviewBody: This is my favorite backpack I’ve had. It’s lightweight, easy to get stuff in and out of and the water bottle pockets are actually a decent size! My 40 oz water bottle can fit in them! I really like the strap that helps hold my water bottle in place. My 12.9 in iPad Pro with keyboard case easily fits. I don’t use the removable sleeve as the laptop pocket has decent padding to it and the sleeve just adds bulk. My only complaint is that I wish there was a pocket for smaller items. I think since they have a mesh one on the laptop sleeve, they didn’t put one in the backpack, but I don’t use the sleeve. I had a North Face Recon backpack and I hated it. It was heavy, tipped forward all the time no matter what I had in it and was difficult to get stuff in and out of since the zippers don’t go down far. Sold it and got this one instead!
review.name: Great backpack

review.reviewBody:
I bought this backpack for an international travel carry on.  The side pockets have mesh and it was perfect for a bottle of water and then some.  The capacity was convenient.  The center pocket is also easily accessible and sizable.  

The interior of the bag was big enough for a bunch of snacks, books, extra clothes, etc.  

I would definitely recommend.
review.name: Great backpack for carry on

review.reviewBody: Assos Equips jerseys have been the gold standard of race jerseys for years.  This latest iteration is pure perfection.  This jersey fits me like a glove and the sleeves are awesome.  A little longer than past versions and ribbed.  This is a typical Assos Equipe sized jersey.  Designed to fit with no extra material or sag.
review.name: Best Equipe jersey yet

review.reviewBody: First off, I love the look of this new RS Jersey. I have the torpedo grey colorway, and it blends into the black RS S11 Bibs seamlessly and adds a subtle touch of color and style to the top that looks amazing. I've worn this jersey on gravel, road, and mtb rides and it has held up great. The durability is what has absolutely blown my mind and makes this jersey stand out to me. Recently, I washed out in a corner on a gravel ride, going about 20 mph, and slid quite a ways. I was wearing the RS S11 jersey and bibs, and both are still fully in tact with no cuts, or even abrasion marks. Every other kit I've owned would've been shredded to pieces. If you're looking for a new jersey that looks great, functions exceptionally well, and will stand the test of time (and crashes) this jersey is for you.
review.name: Durable, Comfy, Breathable

review.reviewBody:
I was able to wear this for the first time on this morning's ride and was pretty happy with it! Compared to last year's Equipe RS jersey, the sleeves are the most noticeable change. This jersey seems to have improved in minimizing any excess fabric or wrinkling around the shoulders that I started to notice in the previous version. The arm openings also seem to grip the skin just right so that everything stays put. The fabric itself looks cool and feels sleek.
The ride this morning was super humid and warm, but the jersey felt airy and kept me very comfortable.
Paired with the RS S11 Bibs, it makes a kit that fits my body perfectly without feeling too tight or restrictive, which is exactly how you want cycling clothes to feel.
review.name: A great jersey made better!

review.reviewBody: Nice jacket, well constructed.  However sizing was an issue.  6' 1" tall.  Waistline 38 - 40"; need to obtain the XL size for the body size, but sleeve are too long for my arms.
review.name: NICE JACKET; BE CAUTIOUS OF SIZING.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like your shell jacket and pants. It is lightweight and functional. I was a bit uneasy about the hood that I never use. It turned out that it stays behind the helmet and you do not know that it is there even on a very fast run. You must have tested this configuration.  The zippers are in the right places to provide venting. The liner gives it a comfortable feel.
review.name: recommended

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Plenty of room with lots of pockets for everything like a GoPro, wallet, keys, phone, and lift snacks. You could even bring a ramen packet in the side pocket for lunch. The pass pocket on your wrist is always appreciated, as I cruise through the pass gate, while others are rubbing their chest up and down sensor. The pit zips come in handy for the warm days, as well as the helmet hood for those blustery days. The other day I was on a lift, that was dripping water on me the entire ride, and was protected by the waterproofing. 

Slightly heavier and warmer than my Gore-Tex jacket but the pocket placements remind me so much more of my Marmot Alpinist jacket from the 90's.
review.name: Quality More Affordable Option w/ Great Colors

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love all the pockets this jacket has, and the quality is awesome. I bought it for my husband and he loves the color as well. Great Purchase
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Overall, excellent fit, feel and functionality. Love the sealed seams and versatile pockets.
review.name: Great overall ski jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Exceptionally well crafted for foul weather and versatility: warm pockets and zipper pocket for phone or wallet. End of sleeve elastic insures fit and insulated warmth.
review.name: Warm Versatility

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The most comfortable shell ever!  Wears really well.
review.name: The Shell of Shells

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really well made, I would consider consider the jacket to be in the middle weight category - Not a thin shell or heavy jacket. It kept me nice in dry in two heavy rain storms.
review.name: Dry & comfortable
comment:
Hello there

Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention. I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations. We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via Contact Us | Marmot or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank You.
Marmot Team.

review.reviewBody:
Jacket seems great, but I won't get to put it through its paces until ski season. Seems well made and fit is good. It is a medium and I am 5'10", 180lb.
Docked a star because of delivery. I want vendors to realize just how awful FedEx is. I am nearing the point where I will not buy things that are shipped via FedEx.
review.name: Jacket seems great, FedEx delivery is awful

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great jacket. As far as I can tell, it's water proof. The main zipper and left chest pocket zipper are seam coated. There are 7 pockets total. Four pockets have covers. They are the two normal outer side pockets, the right chest pocket and there is a pocket on the left fore arm that has a cover. The chest left pocket next to the logo is seam sealed. There is a inside right chest pocket, all of which are zippered. The last pocket is mesh on the left inside that is like a big pouch that has an elastic edge. Also on each side there are long vent zippers that start almost from the elbow and come up to the arm pit and then down part way of the sides. On the inside lower part of the jacket, is an elastic that goes around to the front zipper, that is designed to keep drafts and snow powder out. It is held to the sides by 2 snaps on each side and on the right side there are two more snaps to be able to make it more snug.  The cuffs have velcro to make them snug on your wrist. On the inside of each sleeves is an elastic material that extends and has a hole you can put you thumb through. Note: the sleeves are long and this is to be able to protect you hand from the elements. On the back of the hood there is a cord to adjust the hood size. Also on the inside bottom of the jacket is a cord to adjust it to keep it snug. This jacket is lined on the inside that also extends into the hood. It is not an insulated jacket. The hood beek has something to give it some stiffness. There is an old saying, you get what you pay for. You certainly are getting quality and comfort plus more.
review.name: You get what you pay for

Love the colours

review.reviewBody: ideal for walking in the city. only downside is they are tricky to put on

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 GORE-TEX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They were comfy from the first wear, with no rubbing. They have kept my feet dry, warm and comfortable during hikes and I’ve been really impressed. Sizing was just right.
review.name: Great product!

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 GORE-TEX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice, keeps my feet dry. Good grip.  Great addition
review.name: Dry feet

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 GORE-TEX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So comfortable I could walk for miles! Bought half size bigger to wear thicker socks
review.name: Very happy

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 GORE-TEX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] 3 hour hike straight out of the box. Very comfortable and cushioned feel underfoot. I am a woman size 5 - but usually wear a child’s size 6 but needed waterproof so went for adult women’s 6 which is slightly wider fit so a bit too roomy around the top - I wish there was a slim fit version.  Noticed they were too roomy when coming down steep hills !  But super comfy and waterproofing works. Feet not even tired after 15 km.
review.name: Waterproof and comfortable.

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 GORE-TEX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Super comfortable, excellent waterproof quality. I love them. I bought half a size larger than my usual adidas size and they fit well.
review.name: A great purchase!

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 GORE-TEX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It was nice and comfortable when I put it on, 1- but when I started walking with it, I felt something sharp in the heel, which I have attached a photo of. I'm sure only my pairs have this problem. Fortunately, I had ordered another pair of the same model! Also, 2- belts are sensitive and should be handled with care. I'm going to return this product and try the new pair that I received recently.
Thanks Adidas
review.name: Just Two problems

name: Terrex Free Hiker 2 GORE-TEX Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I need a shoe that has more cover in other words I can walk in dirt and rain and not worry about my feet getting dusty or wet. This particular shoe is nice for summer . Now I need better coverage with the same sole. Do you have anything that might work?
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: I purchased a pair of Hokas from Fleet Feet a few months ago, the Gaviota 5s, I exchanged them 2 months in because the back cushion was fully down since purchase. I do not shove my feet into my shoes, I use a shoe horn. These are my 4th pair of hokas in my life and I never had problems until now. When exchanged, the new ones do the same thing but I can't exchange them again. The design is awful not having the cushion connected. I take really good care of my shoes so there is no reason for the cushion to slide down just from basic daily walking. Especially shoes MEANT for walking! These are extremely expensive to be so useless and feel unstable when walking because there is no cushion to help keep it over the heel. There has to be a better design
review.name: Heel cushion isn't connected

review.reviewBody: I have several foot issues and these shoes are great for them love love
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: Purchased these for working at an indoor range where I stand on concrete for upwards of 12 hours a day. I only work 1-2 days a week and the toe of these shoes have started to come unglued and the fabric has a hole at the toe. While they were great to wear, for the amount of money I am really disappointed in the quality.
review.name: Lasted 4 months of light wear

review.reviewBody: Where are the BRIGHT colors? The colors you put out are too too light l!! They get dirty too fast! Manufacture and sell more choice of colors.
review.name: Colors Needed!!

review.reviewBody: I bought my first pair because they were recommended for plantar fasciitis. My condition has improved! I'm convinced.
review.name: I would buy these again.

review.reviewBody: Foot neuropathy and require orthotics. Gaviota 5 has enough room for the orthotics as well as offering a soft foot landing.
review.name: Absolutely

review.reviewBody: Come on guys, I LOVE my Gaviota's, but I also bought them because I soooo love crazy wonderful colorful shoes. What, some people complain that you don't have dull, boring colors and you cave into them and forget the customers that buy these because of the Crazy lovable colors??? PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE Stop with the ugly ugly white shoes and bring back the COLOR!!!!
review.name: WHERE ARE THE COLORS????

review.reviewBody: I have extreme plantar fasciitis, over pronation and flat arches. These shoes are the only thing I have found to give me relief. As long as I'm wearing them, my feet feel ok. Anything else has made them hurt. They have great support, cushion on the heels and stability is good. My ankles don't roll inward. Hope they help someone else!
review.name: #1 shoe for flat feet, over pronation & PF

review.reviewBody: This shoe (I bought a wide) has a beautiful tow box of a barefoot shoe, a zero drop feel, and yet just enough cush to protect your heel and back. I had misdiagnosed broken bones in my foot that turned into bone marrow edema and Mortons Neuroma. The foot then developed Complex Regional Pain Syndrom through all the PT they put me through before healed. Pair that with 8 ruptured disc's, a severed ACL, and Ehlers Danlos and you've got a MESS! IN COMES THE GAVIOTA 5. THE PERFECT SHOE. BUY IT, (or 5)
review.name: Toe box of a barefoot shoe

name: Gaviota 5 Wide Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: This one is ultra light, even in the ultra light category. Seems very well made and technical. Back is so thin it’s sheer. Front blocks wind very well. I love this type of garment over a mid layer in shoulder season and as lightweight insurance on long rides in case of a chill. Roadie fit so size up from your normal T shirt size unless you wanna look like a middle aged sausage link. I’m  6’2” and 175 lbs. The large was comically snug, and I’m pretty slim. Returned it because I wanted more of a trail fit. If that’s what you’re looking for, I recommend the Fox Ranger. Yeah, it’s heavier, less packable and less breathable, but it’s still plenty light to carry along.
review.name: Very breathable and packable

review.reviewBody: I was so excited to receive this hoodie. I love the softness and quality of the BY materials. This was great when I put the hoodie on initially. However, when I washed the hoodie, the stitching began to pull away at hem around the waist - little tiny string around the circumference. I was so disappointed, especially given the price point. I sent it back.
review.name: Disappointing Quality

review.reviewBody: Perfect softness and comfort for travel. Bought the luxe fleece wide leg sweatpants to go along with the crop top and it's the perfect set.

I would buy 3 of these sets if I could! It is beautiful 
Also, it’s extremely comfortable and easy to wear.
I plan on it being my winter uniform 😄 I bought the hoodie with the pants that go with it

review.itemreviewed: St Elias FG GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I ordered this boot without ever having tried on this style or brand. A big phew that I love it! It does run a little narrow, there is a seam that could rub near the ankle line but a good pair of wool socks takes care of that. I have fairly small ankles also.
review.name: Love this boot, runs a tad narrow

review.itemreviewed: St Elias FG GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these boots! I owned a pair for over 10 years, & after many hikes, the leather finally cracked, so they were no longer waterproof. I ordered these, & Backcountry delivered so quickly. I wore them around the house, & unfortunately had to return them. There was an area in the ankle that rubbed, & I couldn’t possibly hike in them, no matter how thick the socks. The return process was so smooth, I would purchase again from Backcountry. Just not ready to try these boots again. I’m giving these a 4 only because I had to return them, but they’re a great boots!
review.name: Great hiking boots

review.itemreviewed: St Elias FG GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I placed the order on the 14th of January and it said the item was packed and ready to be picked up by USPS. Called today to only be told the item was “lost” and that I’d have to order a different size since mine was suddenly out of stock or get a refund. Honestly just annoyed and the woman on the phone just kept apologizing in the fake “customer service voice” which just agitated me even more. Never ordering from Backcountry again.
review.name: Never Received

review.itemreviewed: St Elias FG GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I hesitated to buy these because there's so much variety in the reviews in terms of fit, comfort, size, etc. Regardless, I tried them, and I'm so happy I did! I'm an 8.5 in everything and bought an 8.5 - it was perfect. Broke these boots in slowly, walking a mile or two at a time, and now they're so comfortable and keep my feet warm on long walks and hikes in the snow.
review.name: Love these! Broke in easily!

review.itemreviewed: St Elias FG GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of these in 2017 for my full time field job - I have only just retired them for a new pair this year (2022) because of a split near the ball-of-the-toes area (which I wonder if that could have prevented with regular oiling of the leather). These boots are comfortable, truly waterproof, and sturdy - and I'm going to try taking better care of the leather with my new pair to see if they will last longer than 5 years. Love these boots!
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: St Elias FG GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've been using this boot as a work boot for a while now.  They are very comfortable and have held up well against rough terrain. The vibram soles also give a lot of traction for hiking on steep hills and loose terrain. My only complaint is that the toe of these boots is unusually large compared to the other hiking boots I am used to which causes my toes to slide around while walking on steep inclines or side hilling.
review.name: Great durable boot

name: St Elias FG GTX Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Worked exactly as advertised and makes great coffee with little effort
review.name: French press

review.reviewBody: I deal for hot loose leaf tea and ground coffee. No need to carry another French press or Aero press when you’re looking to cut weight. The only complaint I have is that it’s not all able to be stored in the cup unless you take out the fuel can.
review.name: Hot Drink Lover’s Ideal

review.reviewBody: Great coffee press. Highly recommend for a jetboil!
Honestly, if you are a coffee drinker and you camp and hike with a Jetboil and you don't have one of these... are you even trying?
review.name: French press a jet boil

review.reviewBody: Only used 10 times so don't know how the silicone ring might hold up long term,  Product looks well made and functions as expected,  I recommend this product.
review.name: Grande Press

review.reviewBody: Didn’t fit. Why would your website suggest to buy it if it doesn’t fit
review.name: Doesn’t fit
comment: Hi John, thank you for taking the time to leave your thoughts. The Coffee Press comes in two different sizes, depending on the model of your Jetboil that you have. If you could please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday, we would be happy to see to it that you get one that works for you!

review.reviewBody: Great little product. Packs easy and makes good coffee too. Great addition to my kit!
review.name: Jetboil coffee press

review.reviewBody: Turn your jet boil into a French press.  Brilliant!
review.name: F?ing good coffee

review.reviewBody: I bought to go along with my Sumo, and have used it twice now for a few pots of coffee each time - works great, and cleans up easy.  I have never used the first generation coffee press, but this redesigned unit appears to be an improvement leaps and bounds beyond the original.  Leaves just the slightest bit of the finest residue in the bottom of the last cup poured.  Looking forward to years of use!
review.name: New Design Works Great

review.reviewBody: this works very good and nicely built. I would recommend this to our whole scout troop
review.name: better than expected

name: Grande Coffee Press

review.reviewBody: I purchased this to use on work trips and it's been a great add. Fits a 15" laptop and all other work accessories with room to spare. Especially like front compartment to also carry personal items that can't fit in the carry-on.  The strap to attach to a roller bag is much appreciated as well.
review.name: Perfect travel bag!

review.reviewBody: I like all the features and I bought the fennel/dark slate colors because I really like how it looks in the photos. After receiving it, I was disappointed to find that the actual colors are much lighter and look faded compared with the photos online.
review.name: Colors in Photos are Misleading
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule EnRoute backpack color. Thule strives to give an accurate representation of our products online through photos and specifications. However, renderings and photos on a computer screen will always present slightly different than in real-life lighting conditions. If you do not feel that a Thule.com purchase lives up to your expectations, Thule offers free returns for unused items purchased from Thule.com within 30 days. For more information on Thule return policies, please visit the Thule.com Return Guide:
https://www.thule.com/en-us/help-center/return-policy

review.reviewBody: I ordered the slate and tan, but the color was much more olive and lighter blue than the photo. Not as attractive. I loaded it up with my everyday items and liked the comfort of the carry a lot, but with items loaded in all the organizer pockets, it was then hard to access the ones in the bottom of the main pocket. Quality seemed very good but I think I will keep looking.
review.name: Color not accurate, some quibbles

review.reviewBody: I bought this backpack for my son and he absolutely loves it. Awesome ergonomics as he carries a lot of books to school. Very well organized pocket system.
review.name: The best everyday backpack

review.reviewBody: Perfect size for petite frame. The quality is amazing, priced right. Well worth the money.
review.name: Amazing quality

review.reviewBody: I'm loving the look and feel of this backpack so far. Minimalist looking and high quality are the major highlights!
review.name: Awesome backpack!

review.reviewBody: I was in need of a new backpack and wanted the perfect one for my needs.  I researched for hours and landed on the Thule EnRoute because of the size and the compartments all worked for me.  Not to mention the price was in my budget, and the color.  I'm glad I purchased this backpack, I'm very satisfied with what I got for the price.  The quality is high and I know it is going to last a long time.  Maybe this will be the last backpack I ever buy.  I do recommend you check them out!
review.name: Very satisfied - would buy again

review.reviewBody:
Great bag lots of pockets for little/bigger items 
Will be buying more for kids back to school.
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody: I really like that the backpack has a semi-rigid shell and maintains it's shape when full. A surprising amount of items fit into the backpack with its many pockets. Also appreciate the flexibility of the two outer pockets which can fit a water bottle or wine bottle depending on what you choose! Glasses pocket in the front can easily fit 2 pairs of glasses.
review.name: Solid overall product!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this bag (Enroute, Pelican/Vetiver) for light daily use to carry my laptop, a notebook, and some light accessories to and from work. The bag arrived with some threads loose, which wasn't immediately a problem until the panels on the bag started to separate. The bag is well designed but it's all lost on the extremely poor quality construction.
review.name: Panel Separation After One Month of Light Use
comment:
Thank you for contacting Thule. I am sorry to see the damage to your Thule EnRoute backpack. 
A representative reached out via email to start the warranty claims process to have this addressed. Please respond to that communication to continue to the next steps. 
For more information on the Thule warranty, please visit the Thule.com Warranty Page:
https://www.thule.com/en-us/about-thule/warranty

name: EnRoute 23L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable with a great fit.  Hardly know you have them on.
review.name: Great Boxer Brief

review.reviewBody: I first purchased the 9” give-no-go boxer briefs back in 2017 when they were known for being ultra breathable, and even odor resistant - I remember going with them because of the reviews I read/listened to from backpackers that suggested a single pair could be worn for multiple days without odor buildup.  The 5 pairs I ordered in 2017 lived up to that reputation.  They’re fantastic - while I don’t wear them multiple days in a row, I know that I could, even during hard working days, without having to worry about odor buildup.  They remain very breathable to this day.  I decided recently (late 2024) to order more and wear them exclusively, and immediately recognized that the material is different.  After wearing daily for a week, I’ve noticed they’re not even close to as breathable as my older pairs, and after a day of work I know that these newer pairs could not be worn multiple days in a row while preventing odor buildup - likely boils down to a lack of breathability compared to the older models.  Can’t say I recommend the newer version.  I wish they’d switch back to the older ones.
review.name: Not as good as they used to be
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for providing us with feedback on our Men's Give-N-Go 2.0 Sport Mesh 9'' Boxer Brief. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the product did not meet your expectations.
We will ensure that your feedback on the fabric properties is forwarded to the appropriate department so that we can consider an appropriate solution for the future. 

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.exofficio.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9AM-5P Eastern Time.

Thank you! 
ExOfficio Consumer Care

review.reviewBody:
Over the years since their introduction I’ve probably bought atleast 15 pairs of these. They have been for me years my go to, old reliable workhorse. Comfortable, well designed and durable. But now I have come to the reluctant conclusion that they have gone the way of many great outdoor brands. Submitting to utter profit seeking and declining quality.

A pair of these that formerly would last 4 years of heavy use barley makes it to two. Stitching fails and comes unraveled within the first few wears. The material pills instantly. The waist band stretches prematurely. The fabric wears threw and forms holes. I still have pairs from the old days to compare, and its quite stark how many corners this company has started to cut. The formely breathable yet durable material has been replaced with thinner, and in every way inferior fabric. Especially in the crotch area, which used to be indestructible and yet the best fenting boxers on the market. Not anymore. This company simply
no longer cares about offering a good product. Only a cheap to make brand name that they can still charge rip-off level prices for.
I just purchased my last pair of these. As its gotten to the point where exofficio underwear is now decidedly inferior to it’s competitors. Oh well. The way things are going this company will likeley be out of business soon anyway. 
Good riddance. If you are looking for a comfortable, well made pair of underwear, go elsewhere.
review.name: A formerly great underwear
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for providing feedback on our Men's Give-N-Go 2.0 Sport Mesh 9" Boxer Brief. We really appreciate you bringing this to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the item did not meet your expectations.

We will ensure that your complete feedback is forwarded to the appropriate department so that we can consider an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you for sharing your feedback.

If you have any questions, please contact us at https://www.exofficio.com/support/contact-us or via LiveChat. We're available Mon-Fri 9AM-5PM EST.

Thank you! 
ExOfficio Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: I’ve been wearing the originals and the 2.0 for almost ten years now. They are a great fit, comfortable, and durable. Well worth the investment.
review.name: My go to

review.reviewBody: I love these, very comfortable hiking or laying around and everything in between.   They are my go to underwear.
review.name: Great underwear

review.reviewBody: I read a lot of reviews on these before I bought them. I also kept seeing a ton of people wore them hiking so I pulled the trigger to try them. Let me tell you, these are by far the most comfortable, quick wicking pair of underwear I’ve ever worn. Definitely worth the price. Going to order two more pair.
review.name: Best ever!

review.reviewBody: Best underwear I have worn in years. Comfortable and keeps everything in place. My go to for underwear from now on.
review.name: Best Underwear

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, low odor, and quick drying. The 9" inseam prevents any bunching, but will stick out of shorter shorts. Perfect for commuting by bike.
review.name: Comfortable and quick drying.

review.reviewBody: Comfortable fit for hiking and stands up to wading in local rivers.
review.name: Rugged but comfortable

review.reviewBody: I got tired of my boxers riding up and realized it was time to invest is some nicer underwear. These caught my eye as they have less elastane than most other brands and one of the few that offer a 9 in inseam. They fit great, dry quickly, resist odor well, and don't ride up. Plan to get more as I need.
review.name: Solid all around boxer

name: Give-N-Go Sport 2.0 9in Boxer Brief - Men's

review.reviewBody: Wonderfully warm, super comfortable. Kept my feet dry
review.name: Great boot, always warm and dry

review.reviewBody:
Toasty and comfortable for hours of driving, walking and most importantly shoveling. Do surprisingly well in slush too. Easy to slip on thanks to the side zippers. 
I did have to size up quite a bit, as the other reviews suggest. I wear Women's size 7.5 in Vans shoes, got these in size 9 and it's a comfortable fit. Tried size 8.5 first but they were a bit tight with no room for a thicker sock.
review.name: So toasty! But size up

review.reviewBody:
I love these boots and I highly recommend them. They are very comfortable and plenty warm enough for the winters here (average lows in the teens, lots of ice, average 3-6" of snow). I don't do any winter sports but I am out several times a day walking the neighborhood with the dogs. Not everybody shovels their sidewalks so I walk through a lot of snow. These boots have great traction and they keep my feet warm without any issues.

I normally wear an 8.5 in shoes so that's what I initially ordered. But they were pretty snug and hard to get on and off. So I returned them and ordered a 9 and those were much better. Also, I recommend wearing tall socks that will stay up. I was shoveling with these the other week and my socks ended up falling down my leg below the boot line. I ended up with some red abrasions where the boot cuffs were rubbing against my bare legs. Just something to keep in mind. The wool cuff is generally comfortable but it'll give you a friction burn on bare skin.
review.name: Love them! But I had to go up a size.

review.reviewBody:
My primary winter activities are snowmobiling and pow-surfing (usually doing both in the same day) so I'm pretty pick about my footwear as it has to be good for both!  I've been wearing Sorel Caribou's as my go-to boot for the last decade or so. My biggest issue with them for activities was just how wide/sloppy they are. I love being able to slip them on to shovel the driveway, but less so when i'm brapping/riding technical terrain. And snowboard boots are just too stiff.  I haven't used these yet on the sled/surfer, but I can already tell the fit and sole stiffness is doing to be PERFECT. they were easy enough to get into, but with a firm fit once zipped and laced up. The liner seem comparable to the Caribou so I have no concerns about warmth. 
I'm really really excited to get out into some pow with these! I'll try to update this review mid-season. 

I wear an 8 in Vans shoes and most other footwear. Got the 8 in these and the fit is consistent. I tend not to wear super thick socks, but if you're into thick socks or are in between sizes, consider sizing up.
review.name: STOKED on these!
comment: Rich, thank you for your comment, it helped me decided to buy these.
Alright Rich, I?m pulling the trigger on these over the Sorel?s based on your fit description. I don?t like the idea of my foot swimming in the Sorel.

name: Standard Zip Snow MTE Boot

hasVariant.description: Buy the Continental Gator Hardshell Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Gator Hardshell Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Continental Gator Hardshell Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I purchased a pair of these over a year ago and put roughly 6,000 plus miles on them with no flats.  I'm in Northwest Arkansas which has a fantastic paved trail system.  The trails have areas where fine, very sharp flint rock is deposited, usually following a rain shower.  The roads are OK, but the bike lanes typically are not cleared allowing a lot of road debris to accumulate.  

I was a devout user of Continental GP4000 IIs, but was constantly getting small, pinhole punctures from the tiny shards of flint.  This was especially true of the back wheel where most of the weight is.  After installing the Gator Hardshell I have found flint stuck in the tread, but have yet to have a flat.  My latest find was a 4mm shard stuck straight into the tread. 

There are those who will say "well just get tubeless tires and you won't have to worry about it".  I've ridden on tubeless tires on a mountain bike and had a puncture that was troublesome to fix.  I also tried to help someone that had a flat tubeless tire that ended up calling someone to pick them up because the tire wouldn't hold air.  That said, I think I'll stick with what's worked best for me and these tires.
review.name: My go to tires

name: Gator Hardshell Tire

review.reviewBody: The colors are pleasing to the eye and the shoes are light weight nice for hot days but they are shaped funny. Too long. Leaves room for feet to wiggle back n front and makes feel stepping unstable because your feet move around too much but I got them on sale and I paid for shipping so I don't want to bother sending them back. Also the inner cushion sole was way too thin. Iv been happy with other keens and they lasted me for years .
review.name: Nice color and lightweight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this shoe size 7 for my granddaughter. The shoe was extremely large; too big for even my 9.5 sized foot ! The footbed was also not well shaped like usual Keen shoes. You guys got this one wrong!
review.name: Don’t waste your $

review.reviewBody: My son has worn the Targees almost since he could walk (he is 10 now), but this pair ripped the first week we had them. While Keen is exchanging them, he will be out a pair of shoes for two weeks.
review.name: Bummed out long time Targee wearer

review.reviewBody: This does not come in a size 41 unisex. Please fix this.
review.name: Does Not Come In My Size.

review.reviewBody: These are the perfect all weather shoes. I homeschool and teach outdoor education classes. These are great every day shows for the kiddos, whether we are playing with sidewalk chalk or hiking the hills!
review.name: Great All Weather Shoes!

review.reviewBody: My son (age 8) wore this shoe for about six weeks. In that time, we had to fix the cord four times. The cord comes right off the clasp when the child pulls to tighten it. It is simply bad design; the cord wears off prematurely or the clasp/fastener cannot handle the stretch of the bungee cord. I do not recommend this shoe for this reason.
review.name: Bungee cord lace problem

review.reviewBody: These are the second pair of shoes we purchased for our twins. The girls love the look and we love the fit and durability. Plus they don't squeeze their toes in the toe box. They out grew their first pair before they were wore out and expect that will happen with these.
review.name: Quality at an Affordable Price

review.reviewBody: We were excited to see these kidd shoes as we have so many other keen products. These shoes are very different, they wore out extremely fast,little no no foot support.the sole started to separate. I could go on. The single number one thing that keeps me going back to keen for sandals,shoes,hikers and work boots is their fantastc warranty .I hope this is a one off problem
review.name: Did not last,disappointed

review.reviewBody: These shoes started to fall apart after the first week of school during normal activities. Disappointing from this brand I used to hold in high regard.
review.name: Not well made, brand quality has declined

review.reviewBody: My son is on the cusp of youth and adult sizes. He has outgrown most youth sizes (including Keens), but this style in a size 7 fits him perfectly. This is not his first pair of Keen hiker shoes, and we keep going back to them because they fit well, are comfortable, and can handle daily use, on the trails or at school.
review.name: Perfect for my big kid

name: Targhee Sport Shoe - Kids'
