review.reviewBody: As others have mentioned, do not buy these online. You must try them on. The sizes are not even close to accurate.
review.name: Sizing is way off.

review.reviewBody:
Great shoe. I read the reviews and upsized by one full size (Normally wear a 11, ordered a 12) and not disappointed one bit. Good fit, comfy for a wider/high volume foot out of the box.

Bought as a "hiking" shoe, rather than runner but very happy with the performance. Tread is grippy, and does a nice job handling mud.
review.name: Excellent All-arounder

review.reviewBody: This shoe fits like a glove. It was a  little tight in the beginning, but has broken in nicely. I have a narrow foot. Not sure if it would fit a wider foot very well.
I want to like these shoes, they have all the tools for a great trail runner/hiker, but they simply are a half to a full size too small. Bought 8.5 size, and they are actually more like 7.5 size.
review.name: Good tread, just runs way too small

review.reviewBody:
I originally ordered this shoe in a size 10.5 which is what I typically wear.  When they arrived and I put them on, I could immediately tell that they were too small.  I did live chat with Backcountry who made the exchange process very easy and I got size 11.5 instead.  When these came in they felt tighter than I expected but still pretty good.  I did a few warm up runs and then ran a 25k in them.  By the end of that run my feet had swelled a bit, so the shoes definitely felt too small.  Since then, I've noticed that even with the non-swelled foot, the shoes are slightly too small, almost to the point of discomfort.  

If I could do it again, I would order a size 12 (which is 1.5 sizes up from normal).  Otherwise, I like these shoes.  My favorite part is the grippy Vibram sole.  I also like the support of the heel cup, which seems to custom mold around your heel.  The shoelace cover is so minor that most people miss it, but very helpful to protect from snags when you trail run.  Overall I'm pretty happy with these shoes outside of the sizing issue.
review.name: Runs A Full Size Small

review.reviewBody: SIZE ONE FULL SIZE UP! Great trail running shoes. High quality. Light weight but not super lightweight more on the durable side. Really nice pointy and grippy toe. Definitely looking foward to some technical scrambling in these things.
review.name: Awesome trail shoes

review.reviewBody: I got into a pair of the Alpines after cycling through 4 different trail shoes, and these have been winners. They feel like they are built for the mountains-- rugged uppers, good protection under foot, and killer soles. The precise fit has worked great for technical runs with any sense of scrambling, and I've been comfortable into low 5th class terrain. I was between sizes and sized down for a tighter fit, and am happy I did so. Can't recommend these enough for technical terrain and short/moderate distance
review.name: Stellar technical shoe

review.reviewBody: My favourite trail running shoes of all time, I use them in the mountains, hiking, technical terrain to easy terrain, daily running in the forest, gravel roads, even asphalt with various distances, they are good enogh till around 35-40 kilometer mark. They are super comfortable, responsive, light, grip is insanely good on rocks and all surfaces. They fit me perfectly and are true to size for me, especially when I break them in after around 100 km they widen a bit in the front and wrap my foot nicely, I know for a lot of people it runs very small, I don't have that experience. I swap the laces, as these don't tighten the shoe as well, because they are too soft and stretchy and are easy to snap. Otherwise the shoe is very durable and high quality, first pair hold up to 1200 km with a lot of use in high alpine, no delamination of material, the mesh is holding up to all the rocks, even the sole is very durable despite it's gripiness. Now on my second pair after 350 kilometeres it looks like it will hold up a lot as well.
review.name: Best all rounder, favourite shoe of all time!

review.reviewBody: Been using these as my go to running shoes for everything from short trail runs to long days in the alpine with scrambling.  Love the stickiness of the outsole and performance fit which really holds my foot in place well.  Light and agile with adequate protection for long days out there. I did size up a full size from my "normal" footwear size to find the right fit.
review.name: Jack of all trades

review.reviewBody: Shoe itself is fine. Sizing is another matter. Ordered an 11, every other shoe I own is true to size. This model runs terribly small. At best a 10 1/2, maybe a 10. Worn twice, no more. The rare Pro Deal gone bad. Lesson learned.

name: Alpine Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I’ve purchased Fryes for over a decade now and the fit has always worked out. These booties are shaped weird. Heel too loose with lots of heel movement with each step.

My son gets very cold hands and needs to have his fingers together for warmth and so he can a hand warmer up near his fingertips.  The description of the gloves doesn't mention this, but I think it is a very important feature that makes them not true mittens and that should be mentioned in the description.

review.reviewBody:
I've been mountain running and scrambling in Boulder's Flatirons using the Mutants for several years now. Recently I decided to give the Kaptivas a try as a lower-profile alternative. I find that they feel much lighter and more minimal, which encourages speed, but they're significantly less cushioned, requiring more precise foot placement and providing a lot of ground feel. In terms of scrambling, they seem quite similar, with a slightly better lug pattern (shorter lugs) and the same ultra-grippy material. They also have more of a slender profile, which allows for a little bit higher precision in your footwork. The forefoot is slightly less stiff right out of the box, which could be an upside (for smearing) or a downside (for what little edging these sorts of shoes can do).

I like the sock-style upper, and much prefer it to La Sportiva's thin tongues on similar shoes like the Bushido II. I haven't experienced any discomfort, and the tongue can't migrate around during a run like I've experienced with the Bushidos.

The final note is that the toebox allows a surprising amount of toe splay considering how slender the shoes are overall. That's a pleasant surprise.

For me, these are short-distance mountain shoes for runs where I know I'll be scrambling. For a more straight-forward trail run or on a longer outing, I'm going with my Karacals for the added cushioning and comfort.
review.name: Ground Feel Scramble Monster

review.reviewBody: Bought this shoe 5-6 weeks ago, only wear trail running shoes for grip and stability walking (6 R knee surgeries have made me hyper-careful about slipping), they fit great, a little wonky getting them on, but the padding on the tongue of the R shoe has delaminated from the tongue/body of the sneaker.  I will work w/ Backcountry to figure an amenable solution/compromise to fix/remedy because they are a great company, other than that, the shoes are solid.
review.name: Great, but durability issue(s)…

review.reviewBody: I wear a US 9 and the fit isn’t right.when I run over 5 km my toes start hurting. I contacted la sportive to mention my problem and I was told their guaranty doesn’t cover fit problem so I’m left with a pair of shoes I can’t wear
review.name: Fit problem

review.reviewBody:
There is a recommendation to always size up with La sportiva these were extra tight had to size up! Several times. This would be a good shoe to try on first before committing.
I do enjoy running in them, and using as an approach shoe for moderate
review.name: Great friction. Runs small

review.reviewBody:
This is the best straight up and down technical running shoe I've ever had.  The support, grip, fit, protection, toebox room (better than the Bushido), dust and dirt rejection (add a simple gaiter and nothing will get in, you'll never have to take them off) are stellar.  It is lighter than any other comparable LaSp model (including 2024 models).  La Sportiva please do not take this shoe out of production, it's the best model you have!

Sizing: 1/2size up as with all other LaSp models.
review.name: Best straight up and down technical running shoe

review.reviewBody: i love this shoe, great fit, i size up and have never had blisters. the "slip on" style tongue is comfortable and snug; the grip is great adn the lugs are the right size for year round use in the pnw. how ever there toebox always ends up blowing out, seems like an obvious weak spot on the shoe. please make other colorways, they always seem limited and are quite bad in my opinion.
review.name: great shoe with some drawbacks

review.reviewBody:
Bought these a month ago and I hate to say I'm disappointed. I've been running in the Bushidos for a long time but wanted a rock plate for some of the fast rocky downhill races I do, figured I would try these!

After reading the reviews this shoe seemed perfect for me! I either got a bad batch or the wrong shoe... 

The heel cup is pretty poor for my heel - a lot of friction and blisters. Blisters. Tried a different orthotic and it made it worse. When I'm running down uneven rocks I've felt my heel almost come out the side at times when my forefoot and balance feel in control.. felt weird. All the pictures in the reviews show a different shoe with a better looking heel cup, similar looking to my bushidos but look different from the Kaptivas I bought.


The lace system is either too tight or too loose, which is super frustrating. Plus it already started to rip! Only after 4 weeks and maybe 50 miles on them. 

I also had issues with my feet cramping for the first 3 weeks when wearing these shoes. I didn't notice the cramping this week but my blisters were so painful I may not have felt it. 

Overall, these shoes are a huge disappointment for me. After one month they are already looking ripped and worn. I'm going to try and get a return or warranty for them because of the rips but am buying the Bushidos for my race in September because the Kaptivas are a no go for my foot. 

I'll upload photos if it let's me. Proper fit overall though. Unsure why these do not get along with my feet when they seem similar to the Bushidos.
review.name: Bad batch maybe?

review.reviewBody:
BEST SHOE ON THE MARKET
WORST COLORWAY
PLZ JUST MAKE AN ALL BLACK AT LEAST
review.name: #1SHOE WORST COLORWAY

review.reviewBody: I got this shoe and love it so far I have had no issues and feel like I am faster when I run in it!
review.name: GREAT RACE DAY SHOE

review.reviewBody: I own two pairs of these shoes. But I didn’t love them at first because I thought they felt a little snug. But after I wore them on a few hikes and they broke in they are my constant go-tos. They run a 1/2 to whole size small. For example, I wear 11.5 in new balance and I’m 12 to 12.5 in these. Most people in my circles are all about the Altra lone peaks and hoka speedgoats and those are nice and I do own those as well, but I keep going back to the kaptivas! I should let viewers of this review know that The hikes and trail runs I do are usually 12 miles or less. I’m not sure the performance these shoes beyond that mileage.
review.name: Solid shoes

hasVariant.name: Aion 40L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Aion 40L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Aion 40L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Aion 40L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I intended to use this as a second carry-on bag for international flight, but didn't have to put it under my seat so can't comment about that. As far as packing it through the airports, it was easy to put on and take off (I'm 76 with bad shoulders), rests comfortably on my back and not a strain to carry through the airport. Has lots of room plus very accessible side pocket for may laptop and some magazines and another smaller outside pocket for small items. Very pleased with this pack, and received compliments from others in our group.
review.name: Practical, comfortable for air travel.

review.reviewBody: Got this last week!!! Just great 👍 Has every thing you need for travel
I love the color. Can tell it is made from quality materials.
review.name: Great Bag

review.reviewBody: I love this bag!   It's roomy, comfortable and looks classy.
review.name: Great features and Minimalist look

review.reviewBody: Just purchased a Thule Aion and used it for my recent short trip. As I live in Hawai’i and enjoy traveling to the mainland and foreign countries such as Japan, Italy, etc. I wanted a big enough backpack that can accommodate jackets, etc. for colder weather so I can wear them as soon as I arrive at my destinations. This backpack has multiple slots and pockets for my iPad, iPhone, chargers, keys, passport, pen, etc. I can easily get them out. I have four other backpacks, but this one is so far the best one for my short and long trips. Would highly recommend it for avid travelers.
review.name: Plenty of space for clothes and my important items

review.reviewBody: I bought this backpack, the Thule’s Aion 40L a few weeks ago and test drove it. Here’s what I found. This backpack meets both the carry-on requirements of both domestic and international overhead bin measurements . It fits nicely on the overhead compartments of Aer Lingus and Delta Airlines on my recent trip to Scotland. It packs nicely with ample room for my clothes for 9 days. You can hold a lot of stuff in this backpack and it’s very comfortable to carry as a backpack. I got the Nutria color and love the waxy look!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I purchased the black/charcoal version. This is a great carry on pack that is versatile and not to much to manage once you reach your destination.  The bag has room and depending on how bulky your items are can carry quite a bit but be cautious not to overpack as it will not fit without extreme force in smaller planes overhead.  The ONLY thing I would cautious buyers is the look of the bag after use and when you receive it.  The texture THULE mentions of having a weathered look if factual and when you use it will get more "weathered".  The look is not bad just looks like you have used the bag for multiple trips after your first one.  If you expect the bag to have a "fresh" look all the time this is not the bag for you.  Durability is excellent, definitely recommend it.
review.name: Great Travel Pack!

review.reviewBody:
Some things I would like to see in the next update…

1. Load lifter straps above each shoulder strap to redistribute the weight closer to the body.

2. Side compression straps to compress the pack when not fully loaded, and to reduce the outer dimensions when you’re trying to fit the bag in an overhead compartment or other tight space. When this thing is fully loaded, it has a tendency to look like a turtle shell on your back; compression straps would help with this.

3. Slightly more interior volume. 42-45L would be perfect for one-bag travel

4. Include the hip belt pack instead of forcing people to purchase it separately. It’s an ingenious idea, but it should already be included. A travel pack this size NEEDS a hip belt in order to redistribute weight off the back and shoulders and on to the hips.
review.name: Almost Perfect; Needs A Few Tweaks In Round 2

review.reviewBody: I purchased this bag since I travel by plane once a month for a small amount of time and I wanted a nice carry on. This is such an amazing travel backpack. It has compartments for everything. I like how it’s versatile, I can wear it as a duffel bag, or backpack! It’s the perfect bag for a small weekend trip, or for a weekend plane trip! I love it.
review.name: Amazing bag

review.reviewBody:
Hi!! Thule!!
It's a perfect backpack.
I use this backpack every day.
Thank you so much for making a good bag!
But when I travel for 2 nights and 3 days in winter, the capacity is not enough.
I want to put on a small bag. Like a picture.
please Make it.
please feed back.
review.name: perfect backpack

name: Aion 40L Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been using Granite Gear cordura compression sacks for many years but took a chance on the Sea To Summit compression sacks. To my surprise, they were not only equally rugged enough to meet the rigor of my motorcycle travel, they were also lighter and more water resistant. Quality product for sure!
review.name: Tough Enough

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] When I first bought it, I thought there was no way my massive sleeping bag could fit inside. I was wrong. Stuffs perfectly in and fast, too. Feels durable and I’ve had no complaints so far. It also compresses down smaller than other similar sacks I’ve tried. 10/10!
review.name: Deceptively amazing.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have several sizes of these and use them all. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great sack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use it for a 10 deg hammock under quilt as mine only came with a stuff sack. Works well and is lightweight making it easier to keep things in my bag organized and where I want them in my bag. I've only used it 3 times so far but i don't see any issues of wear and tear for many years as i don't usually beat up a compression sack. I don't store my quilt in it when it's not being used, I just hang it on the hanger with the quilt.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This isn't my first Sea to Summit compression sack. They are durable and well-made and just don't seem to tear or fail. You can really pack a sleeping bag into it. And even though it's not water proof, it does seem to repel water.
review.name: Durable and really compresses

review.reviewBody: This compression bag was going to be for my hammock down under quilt but I was hoping this bag was going to be a little stronger but I'm very weary of the compression straps, it's going to fail me at the wrong time and at that time it's going to be called a fancy trash bag. I would do a return on it but a week out on that is not worth it.
review.name: My little bunny

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Worked wonders for compressing my clothes in my “personal item” carry on. Fit everything I really needed for a 6 day lake stay (granted it’s summer clothes and bathing suits which take up less space). Looking forward to using it this winter when doing some hut trips, too. Would definitely recommend.
review.name: Helpful for “Personal Item” Compression

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect! It was exactly what I was looking for to get my 0* down quilt down to a packable size! Get's the job done and keeps the water out when inside my pack!
review.name: Perfect! It was exactly what

description: Buy the Chaco Canyonland Water Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Canyonland Water Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Chaco Canyonland Water Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I finally used to be a bit ill fitting and not able to withstand daily wear and tear after about three wears. I wanted them for some more casual trail, hiking and walking that involved. A lot of water crossings. I wore them on just a handful of adventures and they’ve already started falling apart. They also fit very weird in the toe box and shoe width.
review.name: Not worth it
comment: We're bummed to hear of your experience.  Have you reached out to our customer service team yet? Give the team a ring at 888.211.1908, we are here to help!

review.reviewBody: This just wasn't it. I tried to like them because I usually love Chaco's. The shoes aren't too comfortable and the stitching that attaches the shoe lace loops to the shoe itself began to fray after wearing them 15 min. I tried to wear them more but it just never got better.
review.name: Don't Bother
comment: We're bummed to hear of your experience.  Have you reached out to our customer service team yet? Give the team a ring at 888.211.1908, we are here to help!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are pretty good! I’ve worn them rafting a few times already. I had to really loosen the front laces to accommodate my foot width, but otherwise I find these very comfortable!
review.name: Comfortable but a little tight

review.reviewBody: The shoe doesn’t fit, the arch is too high. I have tried to get them to stop sending me emails via the unsubscribe button for a few weeks now and they just won’t listen
review.name: harrassment

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes. I wish I had brought more than 1 pair.
review.name: So Comfortable
comment: Thanks for the awesome 5-stars!

review.reviewBody: Bought these to wear at work! I work in a restaurant with thick, tile floors, so supportive shoes are a must to get me through my shift. After wearing for a few days, I can confirm that they measure up well. My feet are comfortable and they grip wet tile decently. I will say that the laces are a bit difficult keep tied, so I’m thinking about replacing them with elastic lock laces.
review.name: Supportive Work Shoes
comment: We appreciate your feedback Hailey!

review.reviewBody: Nice! I love Chacos.  Have many styles. These are a bit narrow in the toe box but thinking they will stretch a bit!!
review.name: Nice! Very!
comment: Thanks Becky! We're happy you love them!

review.reviewBody: Love Chacos, but these shoes hurt my feet! I wear a size 9 medium. These tennis shoes are narrow in the sole?? (below my toes.) My toes are not squished. It is just the sole?? is tight when the shoes are on. Also, the laces do not stay tied without a double knot.
review.name: Love Chacos, but these shoes hurt my feet
comment: We're sorry to hear these aren't working out for you and appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Cool and comfortable. I love the arch support. Only problem I have is with the laces. They will not stay tied. I had to get some cord locks to keep the laces from tripping me up. Otherwise I love these shoes and have them in 2 colors.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody:
I bought these a month ago and received them 2 weeks ago I've worn them approximately 8 times and I already got a hole in the top mesh. It is also fraying as some of the places where the lace loops are sown on. For what they cost they should have a higher quality mesh to not rip after less than a month
I have high arches so I find them very comfortable but I can imagine for someone who doesnt they would not be comfortable.
review.name: Mesh is fragile; only good for high arches

name: Canyonland Water Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice fabric. The fit is odd for me. Too much fabric in the hips and I am not narrow there.
review.name: Nice but...
comment: Hey there! We are really sorry the sizing didn't hit the mark for you. We would love to assist with finding something that works better. Please feel free to reach out to our Customer Care team if you need further assistance, or exact measurements!

review.itemreviewed: All Seasons Bootcut II Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: A very comfortable pants with water, repellent and lightweight fabric for spring – fall hiking, camping, casual wear. Did run large. Stats below, but I tend to be more curvy/muscular on the bottom and these were very roomy through the hip and thigh. ( you can see the Aruba pants for comparison, which is also a six and I couldn’t even get on.) Regular was a couple inches long for my 5’4” height, even  with hiking boots on unless you want them to graze the ground with boots. Also – got the camel brown and is indeed brown and not more coral like the picture showed to me.
review.name: Awesome fabric, runs a little roomier

review.itemreviewed: All Seasons Bootcut II Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Although I never take time to write product reviews, these pants surely deserve one. I’ve been wearing Columbia pants for several years as they fit so well and never look like athletic wear. But these All Season Bootcut Pants are the BEST yet! The size medium in navy blue are so comfortable and look great with a tee shirt as well as with a dressier blouse or sweater creating such versatility to any wardrobe. The fit, the length, the feel of the fabric, and the overall look are amazing! I highly recommend these pants!
review.name: Best fit and best style!

review.itemreviewed: All Seasons Bootcut II Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable, flexible, and long (enough).  Room enough to move.  The Long works really well for tall women.
review.name: Wonderful, comfortable pants

name: All Seasons Bootcut II Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Handles great, is lightweight but durable, good colors, makes an acceptable single for ice climbing and if you’re climbing as a party of 3 it’s perfect.
review.name: Perfect alpine rope

review.reviewBody: We have been using these ropes extensively at my guide service and have been amazed at the durability and lasting water repellency. I have also used this rope personally climbing everywhere from thousands of feet of granite rock climbing in Patagonia to long ice climbs in Alaska and wet climbs on Mt baker. It excels in all areas where weight and supple handling is a priority. It will be my go to climbing rope for a long time.
review.name: Best alpine rope

hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Echo Tank Top - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have multiple OR Echo pieces including short sleeve, long sleeve, and hoody. This is yet another amazing piece of gear for hot weather. No other company comes close to having such a cooling fabric. I highly recommend.
review.name: Amazingly light

review.reviewBody: I love this tank top - super lightweight, super comfortable.
review.name: Unmatched breathability

review.reviewBody: Love this tank! Great for the gym and trail. The light fabric keeps you cool and dries quickly.
review.name: Go to summer tank!

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) I've paddled, ran, worked out and have worn this tank leisurely. Love it so much I now have three
review.name: Nice and light and flowy!!

review.reviewBody: I don't do well in the heat and this is my favorite top. It feels like you're wearing nothing, it's so light and airy. The fit is good and flattering. I like that the collar and arm holes are tight enough for good coverage. It doesn't restrict my movement when I'm rock climbing. I bought a light color and you can slightly see my bra though the fabric, which I personally don't mind.
review.name: Light and airy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this tank for running. It's light fabric and long enough for me. I like the contrasting colors on the arm holes. I'm 5'8" 120-125 lbs and the XS fits great.
review.name: Perfect tank for running

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love how lightweight this tank top is, it's my favorite tank for summer exercise. Absolute best of the brands I've tried, so good I got a second one. I would just love it if they had this in maternity sizes too!
review.name: Favorite hiking/exercise tank top

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Like all Echo products, the tank is very light weight and breathable. It is also a very flattering cut. Perfect for running during the hot summer months.
review.name: Perfect summer running tank

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This tank top is like wearing a whisper, but it doesn't cling to the body like some technical fabrics. I love it and was comfortable wearing it even after I worked out. Dries amazingly fast.
review.name: Wonderfully light

review.reviewBody: The Echo Tank is long and baggy but not oversized. It's hard to pair with anything but spandex shorts, and even then feels simultaneously loose and fitted in the wrong ways. The Echo Tank reads as fitting as "off" as it feels. The Echo Tank is pretty basic. I'd love to see some SPF rating in the fabric. This tank felt surprisingly heavy to me. Not particularly breathable. As packable as you'd expect, so easy to stuff into a running vest.
review.name: Middle of the road

name: Echo Tank Top - Women's

review.reviewBody: These are super light weight and sometimes I forget that I'm wearing them.  At first, the little etched markings on the bottom was bothering me (I can feel them) but eventually I didn't feel them anymore. These are quite comfortable, I wear them daily. I like to drive barefoot so these make it quite easy to slip off and on again.
review.name: Very light weight

review.reviewBody: I own 5 pairs of these and they are great!  That being said the Metallic Anthracite ones I bought did not fit at all, even being the same size “43” that my other pairs. This pair is a full half size smaller if not more.  One other side note is that these clearly had been worn before I bought them.  The other colors are my favorite choice of foot wear.
review.name: Stay away from the Grey!

review.reviewBody: I have been buying Birkenstock sandals for years including the Arizona EVA’s and have loved them.  When my last pair wore a hole through the sole I ordered my usual size of 42.  When they arrived I threw out the box before trying them on as I expected them to fit just fine.  Wrong! The size 42’s I received are a full inch shorter than all my other 42’s. This must be a factory error.
review.name: What is up with sizing?

review.reviewBody: I bought these 3 weeks ago and have worn them everyday since. I’ve worn them to the beach, camping, fishing, to kids activities etc. they show no signs of wear and are comfortable in any situation.
review.name: My go-to summer footwear

name: Arizona EVA Sandal - Men's

review.reviewBody: Had this for over a year and it's brilliant. It does what it says and it's an essential part of my kit. I do a lot of trail running and this is ideal as an extra 'emergency' layer or for the end of an event or a break to prevent me from cooling off too quickly. I like hiking in the hills and it's been ideal as a lightweight jacket when I am working hard too - nice design touches, eg the extra articulation for scrambles / reaching high. Seemed expensive but I have never regretted it. I have the hoodless version in orange/black. True to size.
review.name: Brilliant active jacket

review.reviewBody: Fantastic piece of kit! Packs well into the pocket pouch, is super warm and fits great too!
review.name: Fantastic piece of kit! Packs

review.reviewBody: Super light jacket. Just what I was looking for. Got a medium and it fits close. So happy days. This is my third Rab jacket and I love them.
review.name: Super light jacket. Just what

review.reviewBody: Superb lightweight jacket - great for climbing and belays, very compact for stowing.
review.name: Superb lightweight jacket - great

review.reviewBody: Surprisingly warm for very light weight. So far has worked well as a mid layer for winter walking in Scotland. Very comfortable to wear.

review.reviewBody: The quality of the shirt is amazing. In the relaxed shirts, I wear a2xl but I'm this, you'd need to go a size lower. The loose fit 2XL is HUGE on me. Great shirt tho.

review.itemreviewed: Signature Logo Loose Fit Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: High quality, thick t-shirt !!!!  My hubby loves it !!!  He thinks the size runs a little larger than most brands (he ordered an XXL, black in color), but it's quickly become his favorite shirt !!!!  Thanks Carhartt!!!!!

review.itemreviewed: Signature Logo Loose Fit Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love every piece of Carhartt clothing I've ever bought. The only down side is every loose fit shirts are a good bit to big, if the length was a little shorter they would be perfect.

review.itemreviewed: Signature Logo Loose Fit Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: As always, the fit is great, and the quality is out of this world.  Durable and comfortable are the best words to describe Carhartt products.  If you buy their products, plan on wearing them for years to come.
review.name: You won't believe how long these clothes will last, they are so well made.

review.itemreviewed: Signature Logo Loose Fit Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really like the loose-fit carhartt line. I came across them years ago and have never been disappointed. I generally wear a 3X but the 2X loose-fit seems to fit better. Like all Carhartt gear?top of the line quality.
review.name: Always impressed

Love our loose fitting Carhartt t shirts!
Fit well, superior quality stitching and workmanship! Fabulous!
Can we get a mid weight loose fitting T-shirt with the same quality?
We love Carhartt!

review.itemreviewed: Ultra 50 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
This is my first time purchasing trail running shoes and at first my feet were like “what the ___ are these”, although I’m really growing to love them. I have noticed less back pain since running with these although my Achilles tendon has been more sore. They are flatter than my gym shoes I am use to but get the job done and for the backcountry price are a great buy. The colors are fun too. 

I am usually a size 10 and the 10s were way too small. I recommend sizing up.
review.name: Really like them!

name: Ultra 50 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: It’s been a few weeks now and I’m glad I went with this post.After installing it and making a few adjustments on the first few ride I couldn’t be more pleased. My last dropper post had a good life and honestly I was riding with it locked in place for a few years and thought I for the majority of the rides I do and the terrain I’m on I really don’t need a dropper. But after debating it I decided to get another dropper. I don’t use it that much but when I do it’s nice to know it’s there. Hopefully it lasts a while but I’m happy with it so far.
review.name: Time for a new seat post.

review.reviewBody: I bought this several months ago and thus far it’s performing perfectly
review.name: Very smooth and quiet.

review.reviewBody: Smooth smooth a bit longer then stock travel which was perfect but the lighter action is pretty nice. It looks good and fits my Ripmo. It gives a bit better travel then stock and is a bit lighter. We will see how it holds up.
review.name: Better then expected

review.reviewBody:
I had a well known hydraulic actuated seat post that came with the bike.  They are known for  being intolerant to the temperatures below 32 degrees. After a couple trips to the bike shop and a rebuild, it was never right.     
I went to a Carbon Fiber seatpost for a while because of the hassle.       I recently purchased a Highline 7 Dropper Seatpost and was pleasantly surprised how it performed.   It is no wonder that it has higher reviews than most other dropper posts. A very good value
review.name: I love the smooth lever action

name: Highline 7 Dropper Seatpost

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Osprey is my favorite brand of backpack. I have bought several. I was excited to see that you created this pack. One drawback is that the opening is not very wide. My REI pack opens much wider. I wish that they would’ve made the opening bigger.

review.name: This was a gift for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Pack is great for a day trip and fits a slim frame easily. Cinch may take some getting used to but is easy to manage once used to the system. It helps to loop the string on the hook at the top to avoid excess string hanging down. Overall, I am very satisfied with this pack. I took it for a day hike to Angels Landing, and it stored everything I needed and was easy and lightweight to carry. It's my first Osprey, and I am pleased with the durable material, fit, and comfortability.
review.name: Pack is great for a

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this pack. It is my first Osprey pack. I have walking for years and have tried several different packs. Osprey was recommended by a friend. I bought it for my 35 mile Great Saunter around NYC! It was one of the best decisions I’ve made. It was lightweight, fit all my essentials, my back wasn’t sweaty nor were my shoulders tired. Thank you so much! My Osprey will be my walking companion moving forward!
review.name: I love this pack. It

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome bag. Biggest area of improvement I can see is the way the cinch secures. It can be a challenge/awkward to hook and unhook, especially with cold hands. Other than that I really like the size, water reservoir pouch, daisy chain loops, durability, and weight all things considered.
review.name: Awesome bag. Biggest area of

review.name: Great day pack! Lightweight and

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the size of the bag for traveling. Unfortunately I came off my first international flight only to find the cover for the backpack straps had the zippers completely disconnected & no way to reconnect them. I’m on a 2.5 week trip & this makes it really difficult.
review.name: I love the size of

review.reviewBody: I bought this Osprey at the last minute because I had. Sojourn 45 and love it but it was a smidge too small for space I needed. Osprey is consistently quality, wheels, zippers and it fits a lot. I travel 300 days out of the year on conservation projects in Asia and Africa. Osprey is rugged with option of backpack straps.
review.name: Osprey Best Bag

review.reviewBody: We are traveling to Europe next fall for several months. We ordered our new wheeled backpacks now because we wanted to try them out so that we know we made the right decision. We have recently retired, 60+, healthy and will be traveling to multiple locations via train, plane and foot. After multiple reviews of different companies, we both decided on different Osprey products. I chose the Osprey Sojourn 60L Wheeled travel backpack. My husband chose the Osprey Farpoint 65L Wheeled Backpack. We both like our wheeled backpacks for different reasons. Concerning the Sojourn, I love the adjustable straps, the density of the fabric, the zippers that have a loop for safety, the inside straps for compression, mesh pockets and how large it is. The only drawback is it weighs a little more than the Farpoint and does not have enough exterior pockets to throw additional items in such as small purchases, maps etc. You need to open the large interior zipper to do this. The Farpoint, is lighter to carry, has so many more exterior pockets for a simple insert of purchases, maps etc. We understand, this gives easier access, but there are options for locks to be added. The fabric is not as dense and heavy as the Sojourn and is lighter to carry. Filling up both bags is easy and hold about the same amount of items in the large interior space. The wheels on both products are different, but appear heavy duty. If you are looking for a durable rolling suitcase that has multiple straps in the interior of the suitcase with adjustable straps for backpacking, nice rolling wheels, large interior space, the Sojourn is the answer. If you are wanting to save $ but get a great bag with lots of accessible pockets, less weight to carry on your back and also has large interior space, the Farpoint is your answer. Prior to choosing which bag best suits your style of travel, go watch the video on any bag they have available. This made our options of what we both chose easier.
review.name: Sojourn or Farpoint, it's a toss up!

name: Sojourn 60L Bag

review.reviewBody: I like the style, fit and warmth. The only weird thing is that it needs one more snap. The lowest snap is higher than my belly button. That might get cold on windy days.

review.itemreviewed: Oakbury Synthetic Quilted Shirt Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable & perfect for cool days..
review.name: Love the color

review.itemreviewed: Oakbury Synthetic Quilted Shirt Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is the perfect (in between down jacket and no jacket) weight jacket, I wear it all the time! I’ve only had it for a couple of months and haven’t washed it yet, but it seems well made and fits great. Roomy in arms and torso for layering, nice texture fabric, side pockets are set a little far back, but they work fine, chest pockets big enough to hold phone, I recommend!
review.name: Perfect Light Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Oakbury Synthetic Quilted Shirt Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I really like this jacket for casual wear.  It's not meant for super cold weather but it's fine for milder weather.  I'd give it 5 stars if it had an inside pocket and a hanger loop. 
5'3" 125 lbs and the size Small fits well with room for layering.
review.name: Great casual jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Oakbury Synthetic Quilted Shirt Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: If you've moved on from skinny jeans and you need a jacket to complement your new wide leg jeans then look no further. Wide leg jeans need a shorter, boxier jacket to complete the  look; this jacket checks all those boxes and will give you what you need to pull off a more fashion forward  silhouette. Lightweight and surprisingly warm, this jacket is a pleasure to wear.
review.name: On Trend Short Boxy Jacket

name: Oakbury Synthetic Quilted Shirt Jacket  - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Hat fits great and I like that the bill is foldable 
Not sure why they have two buttons on each side and I wish they had more colors but I have no regrets buy it.
review.name: Great cap.

review.reviewBody: I got the size medium, and it's too tight. Even so, the material is very thin, the bill is very short, and the ear flaps don't actually cover your ears. So, it isn't what I was looking for. It probably would work for someone who lives in a might-be-cold-sometimes climate who is looking for a cute hat to wear.
review.name: Definitely not for a real winter

review.reviewBody: Very nice hat and keeps my head warm
review.name: Yukon Cap

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable, durable, great fit, attractive, warm and cozy. Happy place. XL size fits a big noggin!
review.name: Lovely Hat

review.reviewBody: The folding brim allows you to wear it anywhere. If you want to take it off you just fold the brim and stuff the hat either into a pocket or down the sleeeve of your jacket. I really wish they would make a herringbone tweed one. I think it might look great. A subdued heringbone style would make it easier to wear in less rustic settings.
review.name: Perfect Hat for Me...almost

review.reviewBody: I really love this hat. It's just the right amount of warm when it's chilly. It has a visor for the bright sun. And it's unique and cute. Also it seems to go with everything. I had one just like this and lost it, so I am especially glad to have it "back" again!
review.name: I Love the Yukon Cap!

review.reviewBody: Comes a bit small but molds into you, nice materials.
review.name: Very nice

review.reviewBody: This is quite a lovely hat, seemingly well made and attractive. The top of the cap is warm enough, but the ear flaps will not keep your ears warm. They hang down loosely so that any little bit of breeze will blow right in. If you're the sort of person who does not get very cold, then perhaps it will be fine for you. Personally, my ears are very sensitive to the cold, so this was no good. I tied a bit of elastic around the back, connecting the two ear flaps together so they would stay down tightly around my head, which works decently. Overall, I like the hat very much. It just needed a bit of engineering on my part.
review.name: Nice hat, weak ear flaps

review.reviewBody: Over ten years ago I bought a winter hat with a visor at an army surplus store and when it got too small for me I was devastated. I was thrilled to see this and orders a large right away! Love the colour and the lining is very warm. It was perfect for late fall kayaking on a sunny day! The fact that the brim folds is useful to take up less space when packing. I wish the visor came out a bit more, and the ear flaps were a bit larger and longer BUT I have a big face and head so that's just me!
review.name: Finally!

review.reviewBody: ive had one of these awesome hats for years last winter my most liked hat started to fall apart. after finally ordering on that i don't like the color of it is just printed fleece. my old hat is a woven wool mix, wayyyy better hat... not sure why they changed the materials to something so flammable you may not want it on your head. though its still comfy and seems like it will be just as warm. and sadly no one else makes an ear flap Cadet Cap like these... OR please bring back the old designs/Materials these plaids are UGLY!!!! but i love this hat!!
review.name: love these hats ...however new materials are questionable

name: Yukon Cap

review.reviewBody:
I've been searching for something that fits my feet just like my old Hiangles did. I've been wearing the purple synthetic Hiangles and also the pink leather Hiangles in size 6 and 6.5 for a while now. My street shoe is generally a 6, and I bought these in 6.5 (women sizing) and also have a narrow forefoot and heel. 

I'm really glad I took a chance on the TN Pro LV because they have all the minor modifications that I really was looking for in my old shoes. These feel not as stiff and a bit more sensitive than the Hiangles. I could really flex my foot and power through my toes with precision. Heel cup stays on snug and does not cut into my ankles. Right out of the box, they were comfortable, no hotspots and I was able to climb a full session with these. I would buy the TN Pro LV over and over again. 

I just hope Backcountry keeps these in stock!
review.name: Like the old Hiangles but better

name: TN Pro LV Shoe

hasVariant.name: Qubo Power Fluid Trainer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Elite Qubo Power Fluid Trainer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Just a guy with a Trek fitness bike. Several years after purchasing the bike, Covid-19 helped me see it as probably the last outdoors option, above walking, that I can do to improve my fitness. 

The price wasn't outrageous. The set-up took all of 7 minutes. The first 10-minute workout left me assured I will be able to avoid starting from scratch at the start of my 2nd season on 2 wheels. 

The unit isn't loud, and I've spent the first couple of workouts in easier gears, as the resistance is more than enough.
review.name: Checked all the boxes

hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized 2Bliss Ready Tire Sealant online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have used this sealant for about 20 months now. I have had multiple punctures, seemingly small enough to seal and they never do, causing me to resort to plugging the tire. I ran these because I am using the Specialized RapidAir 2Bliss, which itself is not a cheap tire to be continually ruining because this sealant fails to seal just about any sized hole I've encountered.
review.name: Avoid

review.reviewBody: This does not work very well, you are way better to stick with Stans. I have used Stans in the past, but then purchased this because I was using it along with specialized tires and rims so I thought maybe it would be better to use their formula. That was a mistake. So far I have had two punctures while out riding with it and it didn't seal either of them. In both cases I had to limp home, stopping to put more air in every couple of kilometers which would then slowly bleed out. I then put Stans sealant into one of the tires that the specialized sealant had been unable to seal, and it sealed it quickly and with no problem. I will never use this again.
review.name: Stans is way better

name: 2Bliss Ready Tire Sealant

description: Buy the Peak Refuel Chicken Alfredo - 2 Servings online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chicken Alfredo - 2 Servings
hasVariant.description: Buy the Peak Refuel Chicken Alfredo - 2 Servings online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My family is used to getting 3 solid servings out of the outdoor herbivore 2-3 servings. We wanted to try this brand to add variety and keep our 7 year old more happy and full. This particular meal was super tasty but our 7 year old ate almost all of it so not sure it is really two servings! We?d have to buy 2-3 packs of this one and that would take up a lot more space in the pack. So we are trying to figure out how we can make that happen because we did like the flavor!
review.name: Great flavor, not a lot in this one

name: Chicken Alfredo - 2 Servings

review.reviewBody: I've used numerous PI gloves in the past. Always the gel type, and always size medium.  These are pretty snug, but still have a great feel and I think will stretch more after more hours.  Really hard to get on though.  I ended up cutting the thread at the seam 1/2 inch and sewing a few stitches to keep it from separating any further. Have found over the years that no padding actually helps prevent numbness, as opposed to the gel palm style. Seems to be made of high quality materials..
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Padded gloves make my hands numb, these are great
review.name: Great glove with no padding

review.reviewBody:
I have owned almost every version of the Pro air gloves Pearl has dropped over the last 6+ years. They, without a doubt, are my favorite gloves. 

This most recent iteration having the synthetic leather palm is a bit of an adjustment since the seams need a ride or two to break in before being as comfortable as the prior versions, but I already notice a difference in durability for the better.  

The previous versions would only last me 3000-4000 miles before I had to replace them. cleaning glass off tires while riding downtown doesn't help 😅 ( Bike delivery life on a campus) 

Honestly, I didn't even care about the durability/longevity. I would happily pay full price for a fresh pair 1-2 times a year, as they are simply the best-fitting glove I've used.
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody: Glove is amazing, good grip. A bit tight in the beginning, but adjusts with mileage.
review.name: Perfect fit

name: Pro Air Glove - Men's

description: Buy the Nikwax Footwear Cleaning Gel online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Footwear Cleaning Gel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nikwax Footwear Cleaning Gel online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Used this to clean my Gore-Tex hiking boots after a full summer of heavy use hiking and backpacking. After being caked in dirt, they looked brand new after I finished cleaning them with this. Super easy and super quick. Would highly recommend to anyone looking to refresh their footwear.
Works great for cleaning my hunting boots prior to treatment. Use Nikwax products for treating my boots after a good clean. Can’t go wrong with their products!

Mountaineering and hiking boots are pricey, so I want to keep them looking and performing at their best. This cleaning gel does just that. It’s easy to use and great for both synthetic and leather footwear. I always have a bottle in my gear closet for scraping off mud and debris after my adventures outdoors.
review.name: Great for keeping your boots in tip top shape

review.reviewBody: Throwing shoes in the washing machine removes the dirt, but doesn't make them white again. This product works better than a magic eraser.
review.name: Makes Sneakers White Again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wore my favorite shoes to a (very muddy) music festival and came home to more mud than shoe.  I rinsed them off, but the dirt was caked on.  This cleaner did a fantastic job bringing my shoes back to life! It's easy to use and left my shoes looking great.
review.name: cleans well

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I don’t typically polish my shoes however I saw this product and thought I’d give it a try. I was pleasantly surprised at the outcome. With very little Nikwax on a soft cotton cloth, my shoes looked like they were brand new after a few rubs and a little elbow grease.
review.name: Shoes looked brand new!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This footwear cleaning gel is definitely worth the purchase. My husband works on construction sites and around our farm. His boots are constantly getting dirty and no other products worked to clean them. I used this product to clean his boots and they looked almost brand new. Definitely worth having in your cleaning arsenal.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This cleaning gel works well on the different types of shoes I have used it on. It is a bit messy but overall, I am happy with the way that it works. I seemed to get pretty good results on shoes that were not too dirty. I would continue to use this cleaner.
review.name: Works well

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] this is a one size fits all cleaner. I use it on my leather work shoes, and my sneakers. comes with sponge applicator to apply to shoes. cleans well.
review.name: great for all shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Received this product and I am very happy with the results. As a trial I tried it in a pair of old dirty white sneakers I almost gave up on. After applying the solution and using the brush to scrub all of the dirt/stains/grime came right off. It is so easy and simple to use and a must have if you own sneakers that need frequent cleaning. I will definitely be buying more of this product in the near future.
review.name: Good shoe cleaner

name: Footwear Cleaning Gel

description: Buy the Chris King ThreadFit 30mm Bottom Bracket - Ceramic online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: ThreadFit 30mm Bottom Bracket - Ceramic
hasVariant.description: Buy the Chris King ThreadFit 30mm Bottom Bracket - Ceramic online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: If you ride conditions that end up washing out your bearings often, then ceramic is for you. We had one seal get opened up. Even without grease, the bearing was able to be revived to its original glory with a flush and fresh grease. No need to unfreeze a rusty steal bearing and live with the decrease in performance due to the rust etching the bearing.
review.name: Ceramic for mountain biking!

name: ThreadFit 30mm Bottom Bracket - Ceramic
